commit_message:
[Neutron-FWaaS] Freescale FWaaS Plugin

blueprint: freescale-fwaas-plugin

Change-Id: I816a3dce69a7a0865da860055abca2bc53bfba7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/87/126187/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================= Freescale FWaaS Plugin ======================================= Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/freescale-fwaas-plugin Problem description =================== CRD (Cloud Resource Discovery) Service is designed to support Freescale silicon in data center environment. Like Neutron, it uses keystone authentication for all ReSTful calls. Neutron Firewall information (like rules, policies and firewall) is requried by CRD service to manage Firewall deployment in virtual network appliances and openflow controller apps. In order to send this information to CRD from neutron, a new FWaaS plugin is required. Freescale FWaaS Plugin proxies ReSTful calls (formatted for CRD Service) from Neutron to CRD Service. It supports the Cloud Resource Discovery (CRD) service by updating the Firewall related data (rules, policies and firewall) into the CRD database. CRD service manages creation of firewall on network nodes, virtual network appliances and openflow controller network applications. Proposed change =============== The basic work flow is as shown below. :: +-------------------------------+ | | | Neutron Service | | | | +--------------------------+ | | | | | Freescale Firewall | | | Service Plugin | | | | +----+-----------+--------------+ | | ReST API | | +---------v-----------+ | | | CRD Service | | | +---------------------+ Freescale Firewall Service plugin sends the Firewall related data to CRD server. The plug-in implements the CRUD operation on the following entities: * Firewall Rules * Firewall Policies * Firewall The plug-in uses the exisitng firewall database to store the firewall data. The creation of firewall in network node or Virtual Network appliance or Openflow controller app is decided by CRD service. Sequence flow of events for create_firewall is as follows: :: create_firewall { neutron -> fsl_fw_plugin fsl_fw_plugin -> crd_service fsl_fw_plugin <-- crd_service neutron <-- fsl_fw_plugin } Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- No existing models are changed and new models are created. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ Negligible or None Other deployer impact --------------------- This change only affects deployments where neutron 'service_plugins' is configured with 'fsl_firewall', 'core_plugin' is 'ml2' and 'ml2' plugin is configured with 'fslsdn' mechanism driver. fslsdn mechanism driver configuration is used by this service plugin to contact CRD service. Update [DEFAULT] section of /etc/neutron/neutron.conf as, :: [DEFAULT] service_plugins = fsl_firewall core_plugin = ml2 The following configuration changes are to be made to enable Freescale SDN mechanism driver. In [ml2] section of /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini, modify 'mechanism_drivers' attributes as, :: mechanism_drivers = fslsdn Update /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf_fslsdn.ini, as below. :: [ml2_fslsdn] crd_auth_strategy = keystone crd_url = http://127.0.0.1:9797 crd_auth_url = http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/ crd_tenant_name = service crd_password = <-service-password-> crd_user_name = <-service-username-> Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: trinath-somanchi Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- - Freescale firewall service plugin Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Complete unit test coverage of the code is included. * For tempest test coverage, third party testing is provided. * The Freescale CI reports on all changes affecting this Plugin. * The testing is run in a setup with an OpenStack deployment (devstack) connected to an active CRD server. Documentation Impact ==================== Usage and Configuration details. References ========== None

commit_message:
carbonara: do not iterate over values

We use a method of combining 2 timeseries rather than iterating and
deleting values, as it's 2 times faster to do so.

Change-Id: I9b9d56419033e12bd7abf34474fe447757cef944
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/70/150470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.ts = self.ts[:index[0]].combine_first(self.ts[index[-1]:]) if index[0-1] in self.ts: del self.ts[index[1]]
deleted_lines: # NOTE(jd) Is there a more efficient way to do that with Pandas? The # goal is to delete all the values that `ts' is providing again, so # that means deleting the aggregate we did for it too. for timestamp, value in sorted(self.ts.iteritems()): if timestamp >= index[0] and timestamp <= index[-1]: del self.ts[timestamp]

commit_message:
Add dispersion command to swift-ring-builder

Output a dispersion report that shows how many parts have each replica count
at each tier along with some additional context.  Also the max_dispersion is a
good canary for what a reasonable overload might be.

Also display a warning on rebalance if the ring's dispersion is sub-optimal.

The primitive form of the dispersion graph is cached on the builder, but the
dispersion command will build it on the fly if you have a ring that was last
rebalanced before the change.

Also add --force option to rebalance to make it write a ring even if less than
1% of parts moved.

Try to clarify some dispersion and balance a little bit in the ring section of
the architectural overview.

Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <christian.schwede@enovance.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darrell Bishop <darrell@swiftstack.com>

Change-Id: I7696df25d092fac56588080722e0a4167ed2c824

subject: Fix filter_query in drac/power interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-21 12:04:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/97c15d31e718d6d6ccbb3fc25bfec03992ecbcd0', 'message': 'Fix filter_query in drac/power interface

CIM_ComputerSystem resource was used instead of DCIM_ComputerSystem in
the filter query for get_power_state. It caused the response in 11th
generation servers to be in the same namespace as the request, while
12th generation generation servers consistently used the Dell namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1409036
Change-Id: I218a9c3c09208235ee4134eeeb30d878bda6ef6a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-27 13:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/drac/power.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/132bf74c193da563f9bff145169cdded7deba214', 'message': "Fix filter_query in drac/power interface

While enumerating the DCIM_ComputerSystem class, the filter wasn't set
against the same class but against CIM_ComputerSystem in the query for
get_power_state. It caused inconsistency between 11th and 12th
generation servers. In the response, 11th generation server used the
CIM_ComputerSystem namespace, while 12th generation used
DCIM_ComputerSystem. Ironic looked for DCIM_ComputerSystem in the
response, thus failing for 11th generation servers. With the patch, the
response is in the DCIM_ComputerSystem namespace regardless of the
generation of the server.

Closes-Bug: #1409036
Change-Id: I218a9c3c09208235ee4134eeeb30d878bda6ef6a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix filter_query in drac/power interface

While enumerating the DCIM_ComputerSystem class, the filter wasn't set
against the same class but against CIM_ComputerSystem in the query for
get_power_state. It caused inconsistency between 11th and 12th
generation servers. In the response, 11th generation server used the
CIM_ComputerSystem namespace, while 12th generation used
DCIM_ComputerSystem. Ironic looked for DCIM_ComputerSystem in the
response, thus failing for 11th generation servers. With the patch, the
response is in the DCIM_ComputerSystem namespace regardless of the
generation of the server.

Closes-Bug: #1409036
Change-Id: I218a9c3c09208235ee4134eeeb30d878bda6ef6a

commit_message:
Convert unicode to six in heat/engine

This patch converts unicode to six.text_type in
heat/engine for python 3.x compatibility.

Change-Id: I8395582c7e504ff7b710cb5f6034c2f8b6bc8957
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/54/139654/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: text = '{%s}' % ', '.join(unicode(n) for n in self) pairs = ('%s: %s' % (unicode(k), unicode(v)) return unicode(self._graph)

commit_message:
Retry query if db deadlock error is received

Add a decorator retry_on_deadlock(). All db.api functions marked
with this decorator will be retried if a DBDeadlock exception is
received.

Change-Id: I3488bfec67ec1c563292f1b61a7a9697f118809c
Closes-bug: 1348588
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/49/109549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

def api_raise_conn_err_default(self, *args, **kwargs): return self._api_raise(exception.DBConnectionError(), *args, **kwargs) def api_raise_conn_err_enable_retry(self, *args, **kwargs): return self._api_raise(exception.DBConnectionError(), *args, **kwargs) def api_raise_deadlock_err_default(self, *args, **kwargs): return self._api_raise(exception.DBDeadlock(), *args, **kwargs) @api.retry_on_deadlock def api_raise_deadlock_err_decorated(self, *args, **kwargs): return self._api_raise(exception.DBDeadlock(), *args, **kwargs) @api.safe_for_db_retry def api_raise_deadlock_safe_db_retry_decorated(self, *args, **kwargs): return self._api_raise(exception.DBDeadlock(), *args, **kwargs) @api.safe_for_db_retry @api.retry_on_deadlock def operational error'] raise exception.DBConnectionError(orig) if self.error_counter == 1: self.error_counter -= 1 raise exception.DBDeadlock() else: return True self.assertRaises(exception.DBConnectionError, self.dbapi.api_raise_conn_err_default) self.dbapi.api_raise_conn_err_enable_retry) self.dbapi.api_raise_conn_err_default) func = self.dbapi.api_raise_conn_err_enable_retry func = self.dbapi.api_raise_conn_err_enable_retry func = self.dbapi.api_raise_conn_err_enable_retry self.test_db_api.error_counter = 5 self.assertRaises( exception.DBError, func, 'Retry of permanent failure did not throw DBError exception.') self.assertNotEqual( 0, self.test_db_api.error_counter, 'Retry did not stop after sql_max_retries iterations.') class DBDeadlockTestCase(DBAPITestCase): def setUp(self): super(DBDeadlockTestCase, self).setUp() self.test_db_api = DBAPI() patcher = mock.patch(__name__ + '.get_backend', return_value=self.test_db_api) patcher.start() self.addCleanup(patcher.stop) def test_raise_deadlock_error(self): self.dbapi = api.DBAPI('sqlalchemy', {'sqlalchemy': __name__}) self.test_db_api.error_counter = 5 self.assertRaises( exception.DBDeadlock, self.dbapi.api_raise_deadlock_err_default) def test_raise_deadlock_error_db_reconnect_enabled(self): self.dbapi = api.DBAPI('sqlalchemy', {'sqlalchemy': __name__}, use_db_reconnect=True) self.test_db_api.error_counter = 5 self.assertRaises(exception.DBDeadlock, self.dbapi.api_raise_deadlock_err_default) self.assertEqual(4, self.test_db_api.error_counter, 'Unexpected retry') def test_raise_deadlock_error_connection_error_decorated(self): self.dbapi = api.DBAPI('sqlalchemy', {'sqlalchemy': __name__}, use_db_reconnect=True) self.test_db_api.error_counter = 5 self.assertRaises( exception.DBDeadlock, self.dbapi.api_raise_deadlock_safe_db_retry_decorated) def test_retry_one(self): self.dbapi = api.DBAPI('sqlalchemy', {'sqlalchemy': __name__}, retry_interval=1) try: func = self.dbapi.api_raise_deadlock_err_decorated self.test_db_api.error_counter = 1 self.assertTrue(func(), 'Single retry did not succeed.') except Exception: self.fail('Single retry raised an un-wrapped error.') self.assertEqual( 0, self.test_db_api.error_counter, 'Counter not decremented, retry logic probably failed.') def test_retry_two(self): self.dbapi = api.DBAPI('sqlalchemy', {'sqlalchemy': __name__}, retry_interval=1, inc_retry_interval=False) try: func = self.dbapi.api_raise_deadlock_err_decorated self.test_db_api.error_counter = 2 self.assertTrue(func(), 'Multiple retry did not succeed.') except Exception: self.fail('Multiple retry raised an un-wrapped error.') self.assertEqual( 0, self.test_db_api.error_counter, 'Counter not decremented, retry logic probably failed.') def test_retry_two_different_exception(self): self.dbapi = api.DBAPI('sqlalchemy', {'sqlalchemy': __name__}, use_db_reconnect=True, retry_interval=1, inc_retry_interval=False) try: func = self.dbapi.api_raise_deadlock_err_two_decorators self.test_db_api.error_counter = 2 self.assertTrue(func(), 'Multiple retry did not succeed.') except Exception: self.fail('Multiple retry raised an un-wrapped error.') self.assertEqual( 0, self.test_db_api.error_counter, 'Counter not decremented, retry logic probably failed.') def test_retry_until_failure(self): self.dbapi = api.DBAPI('sqlalchemy', {'sqlalchemy': __name__}, retry_interval=1, inc_retry_interval=False, max_retries=3) func = self.dbapi.api_raise_deadlock_err_decorated

commit_message:
Remove redundant [C|c]ritical|CRITICAL pattern

This patch removes '[C|c]ritical|CRITICAL' from the AUDITLOGLEVEL
pattern as this pattern is more completely covered by the later
'[C|c]rit?(?:ical)?|CRIT?(?:ICAL)?' pattern.

This also removes a pattern bug as 'CRITICAL' should have been
'CRITICAL|' anyway.

Change-Id: I8c45ee13fb6b40e31bafa744f8fee5f4af7a90f5
Closes-Bug: 1401091
(cherry picked from commit 1ebd7e593924f8c04626764825a82289df2e1e96)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/77/150377/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactor auth plugin loading

I wanted to move the auth plugin loading code out of connection
for a couple of reasons:
* I wanted to be able to get a list of auth plugins without a
  connection.
* In the future, we'll want to load service extensions which the
  module loader can handle.
* The loading of service extensions needs to happen before we
  have a connection so we can assemble user preferences for those
  services.
At some point I think the user preference class will have the
module loader and handle these things, but I think it would be
a lot to digest all those changes.

Change-Id: I3abc47a6252bfca26cc1ab2e33553fe06b7b14c2

commit_message:
Setup the api-config.yml so it can be used with mini-mon

Makes it easier to debug the API running on your dev system.

It is setup to use keystone authentication so you must provide
the proper credentials when making API calls

Change-Id: Ia5868387c6d47f9856cb01dfb490f1c89c92ab6e

Add a README file

After moving the project into a separate project it's
required to add a README file. This patch adds one with
some links to all required information.

Change-Id: I7ec9ead7c574d42863a768c708f9a7f2500209e0

subject: Cisco N1KV: Enable HTTPs communication with VSM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-31 07:26:59.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron/plugins/cisco/cisco_plugins.ini', 'neutron/plugins/cisco/n1kv/n1kv_client.py', 'neutron/plugins/cisco/common/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/cd6212276af9ea65bfc906323e7ae6e5cd991f4c', 'message': 'Cisco N1KV: Enable HTTPs communication with VSM

Right now Cisco N1KV communicates with VSM using http.
This commit will make HTTPs the default communication of the plugin
and will also enable to configure that the plugin does SSL
verification of the VSM certificate.
The verification is optional since it needs an out of band
way to put the VSM certicate in the controller.
Closes-Bug: 1365600

Change-Id: Id9eacbc208261b3917d15c2a9959317d8e2a99ac
'}]
commit_message:
Cisco N1KV: Enable HTTPs communication with VSM

Right now Cisco N1KV communicates with VSM using http.
This commit will make HTTPs the default communication of the plugin
and will also enable to configure that the plugin does SSL
verification of the VSM certificate.
The verification is optional since it needs an out of band
way to put the VSM certicate in the controller.
Closes-Bug: 1365600

Change-Id: Id9eacbc208261b3917d15c2a9959317d8e2a99ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/144592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('enable_https', default=True, help=_("Enable HTTPS for communication with VSM")), cfg.StrOpt('ssl_certificate', default='', help=_("Path and filename of the VSM SSL certificate")),

The precedence of command loading are as follows:

loaded later. To greatly change the execution of a command for your particular

work as library functions will be needed. If desired this change can be
expanded to include that functionality.

appropriate directory (/v2.0/contrib) or by installing a package into the
environment with a name that ends with '_python_neutronclient_ext'.

* exposes new commands through a dictionary whose key is the command and value

* hard coded commands are loaded first

loaded later. To greatly change the execution of a command for your particular
extension you only need to override the execute method.

commit_message:
Client command extension support

The extension support provided by this change is limited to shell extensions.
The library is not extended by this change. Another change to make extensions
work as library functions will be needed. If desired this change can be
expanded to include that functionality.

Extensions are installed by either placing a conforming module in the
appropriate directory (/v2.0/contrib) or by installing a package into the
environment with a name that ends with '_python_neutronclient_ext'.

A conforming module, at a minimum:
* exposes new commands through a dictionary whose key is the command and value
  is a class that subclasses an extension.ClientExtension* class
* provides classes that subclass extension.ClientExtension* classes

Provides client command extensions through a new class, NeutronClientExtension.
The precedence of command loading are as follows:
* hard coded commands are loaded first
* contribued commands (those in /contrib)
* external commands (installed in the environment) are loaded last

Commands that have the same name will be overwritten by commands that are
loaded later. To greatly change the execution of a command for your particular
extension you only need to override the execute method.

An example extension, while not included, can be seen at:
https://github.com/Cerberus98/quark_python_neutronclient_ext

Change-Id: Ie999d06e558263887dbc3e2b56320430017506c1
Implements: blueprint extensible-neutronclient

commit_message:
Update BASE_VERSION from 5.1.1 to 6.0

Our master branch is 6.1 now, so it makes more sense to base on 6.0.
Moreover, it fits our upgrade story - we should have only one
upgrade chain.

Related-Bug: #1413253
Change-Id: I9ff5c5fecd25a5d0d30c01368f265766f5221bcd

Add swift file_system monitoring

* Set a threshold of 90%

Add a @handle_errors decorator, that wraps the method in a try-except
with the exceptions.handle() call in it. This lets us define consistent

Change-Id: I47cdfac7e9beb98ccbe3aa5eeefdf81741cfbb7e
Implements: blueprint horizon-boilerplate-error-handling

commit_message:
A decorated for handling errors

Add a @handle_errors decorator, that wraps the method in a try-except
with the exceptions.handle() call in it. This lets us define consistent
error handling for a particular API call, without having to copy-paste
a lot of boilerplate code and repeating messages everywhere.

Change-Id: I47cdfac7e9beb98ccbe3aa5eeefdf81741cfbb7e
Implements: blueprint horizon-boilerplate-error-handling
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/49/98049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools import inspect def handle_errors(error_message, error_default=None, request_arg=None): """A decorator for adding default error handling to API calls. It wraps the original method in a try-except block, with horizon's error handling added. Note: it should only be used on functions or methods that take request as their argument (it has to be named "request", or ``request_arg`` has to be provided, indicating which argument is the request). The decorated method accepts a number of additional parameters: :param _error_handle: whether to handle the errors in this call :param _error_message: override the error message :param _error_default: override the default value returned on error :param _error_redirect: specify a redirect url for errors :param _error_ignore: ignore known errors """ def decorator(func): # XXX This is for finding the 'request' argument. if request_arg is None: for _request_arg, name in enumerate(inspect.getargspec(func).args): if name == 'request': break else: raise RuntimeError( "The handle_errors decorator requires 'request' as " "an argument of the function or method being decorated") else: _request_arg = request_arg @functools.wraps(func) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): _error_handle = kwargs.pop('_error_handle', True) _error_message = kwargs.pop('_error_message', error_message) _error_default = kwargs.pop('_error_default', error_default) _error_redirect = kwargs.pop('_error_redirect', None) _error_ignore = kwargs.pop('_error_ignore', False) if not _error_handle: return func(*args, **kwargs) try: return func(*args, **kwargs) except Exception: request = args[_request_arg] handle(request, _error_message, ignore=_error_ignore, redirect=_error_redirect) return _error_default wrapper.wrapped = func return wrapper return decorator

commit_message:
Deleting currently scoped project breaks session

If you create a project, add your user as an admin user, and then
while still in that project context delete the project, horizon
behaves inconsistently.  Some dashboards will render, some others
will report permission errors.

This is caused by the invalidation of the current user's token.

This fix will log the current user out with a logout_reason explaining
why, and ask them to re-authenticate.

Change-Id: Id34085d3f61e60b4b1250c6a8eaa64c8f751b6c9
Closes-Bug: #1324662

commit_message:
Horizon new launch instance form

    A new launch instance form in a pure angular development
    Here are the enhancement:
        - better use of less and bootstrap
(part of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/css-breakdown)
        - use of a centralized list of variable.
It makes css customization easier, improve maintainability and reduce
code footprint. (part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/centralized-color-palette)
        - use of angular for all the heavy lift client side (part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/horizon-angular)
        - reduce the use of class based view put the displaying logic
on client side and only handle datas on server side.

    TODO list:
        - provide some tests for the client side
        - split this commit in one for each blueprint

Implements: blueprint launch-instance-ux-enhancement

Change-Id: Ie0d5b33c0919c7378eae30ad51dcd2f8d297861a

commit_message:
Catch connection refused in API request

Instead of using exceptions.check_message in order to determine if a
message from an API request, always catch requests.ConnectionError and
set _safe_message there.

Closes-Bug: #1339885

Change-Id: Iac583846e4899593af1905f049a76624e1563089
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/64/106864/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import requests except requests.ConnectionError as e: e._safe_message = msg except requests.ConnectionError as e: e._safe_message = msg except requests.ConnectionError as e: e._safe_message = msg
deleted_lines: except Exception: exceptions.check_message(["Connection", "refused"], msg) except Exception: exceptions.check_message(["Connection", "refused"], msg) except Exception: exceptions.check_message(["Connection", "refused"], msg)

commit_message:
Allow admin to set instance defaults per image

This adds all of the initial code for setting instance default
values on an image, including the table action and resulting panel.
The Launch Instance workflow is updated to handle these defaults.
This also adds support for the first instance default which is
the flavor.

The Instance Defaults panel can be accessed from the admin images
table. Each field will allow setting a default value and whether or
not the value can be changed from this default. If not, then the
field will not be displayed.

Change-Id: I1fcb603230af6a9e2c23807b3792b6bf9c2bd4ff
Partially Implements: blueprint instance-defaults-per-image
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/63/93063/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 IBM Corp.import json from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _ from horizon import exceptions from horizon import forms from horizon import messages from openstack_dashboard import api from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.project.images.images\ import forms as project_forms from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.project.instances\ import utils as instance_utils class AdminCreateImageForm(project_forms.CreateImageForm):class AdminUpdateImageForm(project_forms.UpdateImageForm): class AdminInstanceDefaultsForm(forms.SelfHandlingForm): image_id = forms.CharField(widget=forms.HiddenInput()) flavor = forms.ChoiceField(label=_("Flavor"), required=False) flavor_editable = forms.BooleanField(label=_("Editable"), required=False) def __init__(self, request, *args, **kwargs): super(AdminInstanceDefaultsForm, self).__init__(request, *args, **kwargs) self.fields['flavor'].choices = ([('', _('-- Not Set --'))] + self.populate_flavor_choices(request)) def populate_flavor_choices(self, request): flavors = instance_utils.flavor_list(request) if flavors: return instance_utils.sort_flavor_list(request, flavors) return [] def handle(self, request, data): image_id = data['image_id'] instance_defaults = {} if data['flavor']: instance_defaults['flavor'] = { 'value': data['flavor'], 'editable': 1 if data['flavor_editable'] else 0 } meta = {'properties': {'instance_defaults': json.dumps( instance_defaults)}} # Ensure we do not delete properties that have already been # set on an image. meta['purge_props'] = False try: image = api.glance.image_update(request, image_id, **meta) msg = _('Instance defaults were successfully updated.') messages.success(request, msg) return image except Exception: msg = _('Unable to update instance defaults for image "%s".') exceptions.handle(request, msg % image_id)

subject: Fixes modal_stack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 18:20:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/a6208ff499cdccf2c7f2afdf9b9a3d3e8f29abce', 'message': 'Flavors View Extra Specs shown as separate page

The admin/flavors “View Extra Specs” row_action is implemented as a modal.
However, it is currently rendered as a full page.  This patch set fixes
this and displays it as a modal (which is much more convenient from a user
experience perspective).

This does not fix a similar issue when the dialog submit button is clicked
(in which case the user is redirected back to a page view of the modal).
This requires a much more intrusive fix.

However, for a simple one line fix, this seems to buy a decent improvement in
user experience.

Change-Id: I69fadb7436fcce679912abb39227ca34e1f6eded
Closes-Bug: #1276735
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-05 18:25:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/c75d3ba0c45c8564f41c97f5a689af1aee0c8e45', 'message': 'Flavors View Extra Specs shown as separate page

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-05 22:49:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/fb73b337950426cc93ce231e081c168175afda4f', 'message': 'Flavors View Extra Specs shown as separate page

The admin/flavors "View Extra Specs" row_action is implemented as a modal.
However, it is currently rendered as a full page.  This patch set fixes
this and displays it as a modal (which is much more convenient from a user
experience perspective).

This also fixes a similar issue when the dialog submit button is clicked
(currently the user is redirected back to a page view of the modal).
Currently, the "on(submit)" handler in horizon.modals.js automatically
redirects to a URL whenever the submit button is clicked on a modal.
This overwrites any modals that are currently on the stack. By checking to
see the size of the modal_stack, and not redirecting when there is more than 1
modal on the stick (the current modal and a previous modal) the problem is
solved.

Change-Id: I69fadb7436fcce679912abb39227ca34e1f6eded
Closes-Bug: #1276735
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2014-02-05 22:58:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1bb48bc680a06b127d295261aa443c5619c5240f', 'message': 'Flavors View Extra Specs shown as separate page

This also fixes a similar issue when the dialog submit button is clicked

Currently, the "on(submit)" handler in horizon.modals.js automatically
redirects to a URL whenever the submit button is clicked on a modal.
This overwrites any modals that are currently on the stack. By checking to

Change-Id: I69fadb7436fcce679912abb39227ca34e1f6eded
Closes-Bug: #1276735
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-23 02:06:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/921c9c0d2587c809fe391fe2b640b5985ed6e17c', 'message': 'Fixes modal_stack

Horizon currently has a modal_stack that enables a sequence of modals to
be displayed in order. A modal can launch a child modal, and once the child
modal has been submitted, the original modal can be popped off the stack
and redisplayed. This functionality is supported by a lightweight,
predominantly client-side front end. Horizon also provides a workflow
feature, that enables similar functionality, however, this is supported
by a heavier weight, set of server- and client-side modules.

Unfortunately, the modal_stack feature was never fully implemented. The result
is that any modal that is launched from another modal will be redirected
to a view in which the parent modal is rendered embedded within a page.
The following comment from gabriel in the server-side code
(horizon.forms.views) provides some insight into the original intention of this
functoinality:

    TODO(gabriel): This is not a long-term solution to how
    AJAX should be handled, but it's an expedient solution
    until the blueprint for AJAX handling is architected
    and implemented.

    response['X-Horizon-Location'] = success_url

The resulting behavior is a very pragmatic workaround for several issues:

1. Child modals may alter the state of the parent modal, so without a
   redirect and full redraw of the parent modal, the data in the modal may be
   out dated.
2. The current implementation of the messaging system is not able to show
   success/error messages while a modal is active (this is due to a bug in
   the implementation).

However, from a user experience point of view, it is undesirable for several
reasons:

1. It requires a full page redraw to return to the parent modal
2. The parent modal is redrawn embedded within a full page, which does
   not look very good.
3. The success/error messages are only shown on the next page redraw.

This patch corrects this behavior with a few very minor changes in code, that
fix bugs/oversights in the original design.

The specific use case addressed is for the admin/flavors "View Extra Specs"
row_action. Please note:

1. The original intent of the modal_stack was precisely for this use case.
2. This issue could also be addressed by re-implementing admin/flavors/View
   Extra Specs as a workflow (although this is substantially more effort,
   and requires significantly more invasive restructuring of the code).
3. This work is a minimally invasive fix for a specific class of bug, it could
   also be extended to be a more generic framework as part of a blue print.

The solution is in several parts:

1. Initiation of "View Flavor Extra Specs" modal

This only requires the addition of the "ajax-modal" class to the appropriate
LinkAction. This ensurese the view as launched as a modal.

2. Fix to submit handling

This is where the bulk of the fix resides (horizon.modals.js). The basic
idea is that on submit, we check to see if there are any other modals on the
modal_stack. If so, we reload the top modal on the stack. This forces the
modal to reload its data (via ajax) from the server. This is significantly
faster than doing a full page redraw, and also much cleaner from a user
experience perspective (although the redraw is not ideal, it would be better
to dynamically reload the table -- but that is a much more significant
undertaking). The bulk of the code is in factoring the existing modal
launch code into a new method "horizon.modals.launch" to enable its re-use.

If there are no remaining modals on the stack, we simply redirect to the
success url.

3. Fix message display

Currently, success messages for a modal are only displayed on the next full
view render. This behavior is implemented in horizon.middleware. A mechanism
already exists for feeding these messages back to the client via the
X-Horizon-Messages response header. By using this method, messages can be
displayed while a modal is active.

As mentioned in a previous commit, we find this fix to provide a substantial
improvement in the user experience for minimal effort. We certainly hope it
will be useful to other people!

Change-Id: I69fadb7436fcce679912abb39227ca34e1f6eded
Closes-Bug: #1276735
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-23 02:11:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e9ed45c7cd17c6734599f8fcd8b7aa6d73b61925', 'message': 'Fixes modal_stack

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2014-02-23 06:11:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/0fbf4242d6b2d99562d702b0982ed227cc87c5cd', 'message': 'Fixes modal_stack

Horizon currently has a modal_stack that enables a sequence of modals to
be displayed in order. A modal can launch a child modal, and once the child
modal has been submitted, the original modal can be popped off the stack
and redisplayed. This functionality is supported by a lightweight,
predominantly client-side front end. Horizon also provides a workflow
feature, that enables similar functionality, however, this is supported
by a heavier weight, set of server- and client-side modules.

Unfortunately, the modal_stack feature was never fully implemented. The result
is that any modal that is launched from another modal will be redirected
to a view in which the parent modal is rendered embedded within a page.
The following comment from gabriel in the server-side code
(horizon.forms.views) provides some insight into the original intention of this
functoinality:

    TODO(gabriel): This is not a long-term solution to how
    AJAX should be handled, but it's an expedient solution
    until the blueprint for AJAX handling is architected
    and implemented.

    response['X-Horizon-Location'] = success_url

The resulting behavior is a very pragmatic workaround for several issues:

1. Child modals may alter the state of the parent modal, so without a
   redirect and full redraw of the parent modal, the data in the modal may be
   out dated.
2. The current implementation of the messaging system is not able to show
   success/error messages while a modal is active (this is due to a bug in
   the implementation).

However, from a user experience point of view, it is undesirable for several
reasons:

1. It requires a full page redraw to return to the parent modal
2. The parent modal is redrawn embedded within a full page, which does
   not look very good.
3. The success/error messages are only shown on the next page redraw.

This patch corrects this behavior with a few very minor changes in code, that
fix bugs/oversights in the original design.

The specific use case addressed is for the admin/flavors "View Extra Specs"
row_action. Please note:

1. The original intent of the modal_stack was precisely for this use case.
2. This issue could also be addressed by re-implementing admin/flavors/View
   Extra Specs as a workflow (although this is substantially more effort,
   and requires significantly more invasive restructuring of the code).
3. This work is a minimally invasive fix for a specific class of bug, it could
   also be extended to be a more generic framework as part of a blue print.

The solution is in several parts:

1. Initiation of "View Flavor Extra Specs" modal

This only requires the addition of the "ajax-modal" class to the appropriate
LinkAction. This ensurese the view as launched as a modal.

2. Fix to submit handling

This is where the bulk of the fix resides (horizon.modals.js). The basic
idea is that on submit, we check to see if there are any other modals on the
modal_stack. If so, we reload the top modal on the stack. This forces the
modal to reload its data (via ajax) from the server. This is significantly
faster than doing a full page redraw, and also much cleaner from a user
experience perspective (although the redraw is not ideal, it would be better
to dynamically reload the table -- but that is a much more significant
undertaking). The bulk of the code is in factoring the existing modal
launch code into a new method "horizon.modals.launch" to enable its re-use.

If there are no remaining modals on the stack, we simply redirect to the
success url.

3. Fix message display

Currently, success messages for a modal are only displayed on the next full
view render. This behavior is implemented in horizon.middleware. A mechanism
already exists for feeding these messages back to the client via the
X-Horizon-Messages response header. By using this method, messages can be
displayed while a modal is active.

As mentioned in a previous commit, we find this fix to provide a substantial
improvement in the user experience for minimal effort. We certainly hope it
will be useful to other people!

Change-Id: I69fadb7436fcce679912abb39227ca34e1f6eded
Closes-Bug: #1276735

commit_message:
Fixes modal_stack

Currently, the View Flavor Extra Specs modal is shown as an embedded
modal within a full page. This patchset enables the modal to be rendered as a
full modal.

The solution is in several parts:

1. Initiation of "View Flavor Extra Specs" modal

This only requires the addition of the "ajax-modal" class to the appropriate
LinkAction. This ensurese the view as launched as a modal.

2. Fix to submit handling

This is where the bulk of the fix resides (horizon.modals.js). The basic
idea is that on submit, we check to see if there are any other modals on the
modal_stack. If so, we reload the top modal on the stack. This forces the
modal to reload its data (via ajax) from the server. This is significantly
faster than doing a full page redraw, and also much cleaner from a user
experience perspective (although the redraw is not ideal, it would be better
to dynamically reload the table -- but that is a much more significant
undertaking). The bulk of the code is in factoring the existing modal
launch code into a new method "horizon.modals.launch" to enable its re-use.

If there are no remaining modals on the stack, we simply redirect to the
success url.

3. Fix message display

Currently, success messages for a modal are only displayed on the next full
view render. This behavior is implemented in horizon.middleware. A mechanism
already exists for feeding these messages back to the client via the
X-Horizon-Messages response header. By using this method, messages can be
displayed while a modal is active.

Change-Id: I69fadb7436fcce679912abb39227ca34e1f6eded
Closes-Bug: #1276735

commit_message:
Edit use heading property for page validation

*Every page has heading. This heading can be used for page validation in
 the same manner as _page_title.

*Make page validation implicit. Heading and page title must be specified
 before calling BasePage constructor.

*_heading and _page_title must be specified through overriding the
 _set_page_validation_data method and setting page_title and heading
 variables

*Move is_the_current_page method to BasePage as there is no use for it
 in Pageobject class, login page has to have its own is_the_current_page
 method because of its special behaviour.

*The LoginPage validation was refactor and test must have been
 adequately edited as well.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I584e94ff8bc6fc6abadebf65c788b5262e78ea33

commit_message:
Combined host aggregate editing forms

Added in workflow step to update host aggregate info. Renamed
host aggregate workflow to better reflect its new functionality.
Deleted old form and template files that are no longer used.
Updated unit tests to be compatible with new attributes and calls
being made. Updated urls and constants to reflect new changes.

Closes-Bug: #1290618
Change-Id: I8f1d6152657e1c10399bb1a987d4db8a8c6a2fed

commit_message:
Add SockJS dependency

SockJS is API-compatible with WebSocket and the server-side library
supports Python 2 and 3.

Prerequisite for blueprint realtime-communication

Change-Id: I852592f9e5fed28524ca5b622111b8dae9033e9b
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Making the "Add member to load balancing pool" modal dynamic

The new behavior is to display only the instances with ip
addresses matching the pool's subnet.The view's form also
filter the taken instances from the list of available members.

Closes-Bug: #1241709
Change-Id: Idc721f6463f6845d5700eb8ea4bef53d57b3c389
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/14/58214/33 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: url(r'^addmember/?$', views.AddMemberView.as_view(), name='addmember'), url(r'^addmember/pool/(?P<pool_id>[^/]+)/$', views.AddMemberView.as_view(), name='addmemberbypool'),

commit_message:
Adds client side validation for image creation

Client side validation for required fields were added in the
admin and project forms for creating Images. Also if validation
fails on server side, the tmp file is also removed. This patch
is based on the solution provided by Maxime Vidori

Closes-Bug: #1253791
Change-Id: Ia14ec0c3e4acbf0fd032fadf849a03a204cd1cbf

commit_message:
Quota delete action at admin project dashboard

This change adds a new option to the admin dashboard to delete project
quota values using nova, cinder and neutron API.

Implements: blueprint project-quota-reset

Change-Id: I9a4547397f1723a337fb8a714d5ddbb9caad1c30
Co-Authored-By: Sergio Cazzolato <sergio.j.cazzolato@intel.com>

commit_message:
Use original context rather than returned value of contribute()

Workflow.__init__ and finalize now uses a return value of contribute
as self.context. However each contribute() method updates context
object incrementally and there is no need to use a return value.
By not using a returned context, we can avoid an programming error
(like bug 1303091) to reset self.context to None.

According to the above observation, this commit changes Workflow
__init__ and finalize not to use return value of contribute()
and update contribute() methods in dashboard implementation.

Change-Id: I70fd35fde66e6dc90281237eb7a0f251809b92ed
Closes-Bug: #1303091

commit_message:
Fixing the health monitor's association bugs

- When trying to disassociate a health monitor from pool, the
modal does not show the currently associated monitors.
The list was empty before this fix.
- When trying to associate a new monitor, all available monitors
were shown including the already associated ones.
- The pool details tab was showing all available monitors when
there were no associated monitors.
- Unit test data update.

Change-Id: I6953addd9d1f7d8c9f3218247d4b0a6ea69d548a
Closes-Bug: #1328923
Closes-Bug: #1328931
Closes-Bug: #1328928
Co-Authored-By: Andres Buraschi <andres.buraschi@intel.com>

subject: Proof of concept for push-based communication
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-05 10:34:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f60064dbe915e63c324881c171c901c444eea7b5', 'message': 'Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses SockJS to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

The server hooks into the OpenStack RPC notifications so we need to be
able to configure the RPC backend, etc.

Start the server with:

    ./horizon-realtime.py --config-file etc/horizon/horizon-realtime.conf

To try it out, navigate to http://localhost:8080, log in and go to the
Project -> Instances page. Then launch an instance using the Nova
command line client and try to suspend, resume and delete it from there.

The UI should update automatically.

Implements blueprint realtime-communication

Change-Id: I2fb1c479c2dd3c6bb7b24564df0a598ff57e09ac
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-29 15:26:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/093dfd519500240e2d901d4369da452d7bd2b905', 'message': 'Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses SockJS to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

The server hooks into the OpenStack RPC notifications so we need to be
able to configure the RPC backend, etc.

Start the server with:

    ./horizon-realtime.py --config-file etc/horizon/horizon-realtime.conf

To try it out, navigate to http://localhost:8080, log in and go to the
Project -> Instances page. Then launch an instance using the Nova
command line client and try to suspend, resume and delete it from there.

commit_message:
Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses SockJS to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

The server hooks into the OpenStack RPC notifications so we need to be
able to configure the RPC backend, etc.

Start the server with:

    ./horizon-realtime.py --config-file etc/horizon/horizon-realtime.conf

To try it out, navigate to http://localhost:8080, log in and go to the
Project -> Instances page. Then launch an instance using the Nova
command line client and try to suspend, resume and delete it from there.

The UI should update automatically.

Implements blueprint realtime-communication

Change-Id: I2fb1c479c2dd3c6bb7b24564df0a598ff57e09ac
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use the bootstrap mixins and fix table_cell_action

    Use the bootstrap mixin functions to avoid the use of browsers
specific prefixers. Also fix the table_cell_action in order to
delegate from the javascript to the css the fade effect.

Change-Id: If555d08ba05f6b2b4e964a2423bb7577ec4aebff
Closes-Bug: #1287616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/84/76284/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* Opacity does not handle 0 in bootstrap 2.* this is the mixin of bootstrap 3.* it is put in a namespace to avoid mixin collision. */ #horizon { .opacity(@opacity) { opacity: @opacity; // IE8 filter @opacity-ie: (@opacity * 100); filter: ~"alpha(opacity=@{opacity-ie})"; } }

commit_message:
Replace horizon accordion nav with an angular one

    Horizon navigation is now wrapped in a full angular solution,
this patch add tests for client side, and a refactoring of the design
especially in order to simplify and reduce the css footprint.

Implements: blueprint horizon-angular
Change-Id: Ib4fe520fed52323fdfcf944d3955299e3769802f

commit_message:
Add support for disabling regions

If there are multiple regions specified in keystone you might only want to show a single one in the dashboard.
This add the option to only show region x.
By default it will show all regions, when ALLOWED_REGION is set it will show the region set there

Closes-Bug: 1356738
Change-Id: I4b3e9742599b17ef2c4bbd7687e106a2bd94cdd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/114145/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Uncomment this if you have multiple regions in your keystone # and only want to show a subset of regions in your dashboard # ALLOWED_REGIONS = ['RegionOne']

commit_message:
Per Project-User Quotas Support

Currently nova supports per-project-user quotas. The purpose of this is
to implement the interactions with nova to support quota per project-
user management from Horizon.

Changes:
- new form for managing quotas for user
- nova api updated to handle user_id when getting and updating quota
- usage quota updated handle user_id when getting and updating quota
- unit tests

implements: blueprint per-user-quotas

Co-Authored-By: Sergio Cazzolato <sergio.j.cazzolato@intel.com>

Change-Id: I117ae7639a85ef7216fd8fd47a9da87767670af6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/57/71957/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def tenant_quota_get(request, tenant_id, user_id=None): return base.QuotaSet(novaclient(request).quotas.get(tenant_id, user_id)) def tenant_quota_update(request, tenant_id, user_id=None, **kwargs): novaclient(request).quotas.update(tenant_id, user_id=user_id, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: def tenant_quota_get(request, tenant_id): return base.QuotaSet(novaclient(request).quotas.get(tenant_id)) def tenant_quota_update(request, tenant_id, **kwargs): novaclient(request).quotas.update(tenant_id, **kwargs)

subject: Horizon errors out when adding myself to a group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-23 06:06:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1c975a428c82f952a0cfedc639281392fa1d039d', 'message': "Horizon errors out when adding myself to a group

Per Lin-Hua Cheng's comment:

    Keystone revokes the token of the user added to the group.
    If the logon user was added, redirect the user to logout.

This patchset implements this behavior for AddMembers and RemoveMembers
actions of the GroupMembers and GroupNonMembers Tables in
dashboards.admin.groups.

Change-Id: I98c2ab804fb29a10aa199616854d10fea976055b
Closes-Bug: #1276735

commit_message:
Horizon errors out when adding myself to a group

Per Lin-Hua Cheng's comment:

    Keystone revokes the token of the user added to the group.
    If the logon user was added, redirect the user to logout.

This patchset implements this behavior for AddMembers and RemoveMembers
actions of the GroupMembers and GroupNonMembers Tables in
dashboards.admin.groups.

Change-Id: I98c2ab804fb29a10aa199616854d10fea976055b
Closes-Bug: #1276217
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/62/75662/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(dlapsley): if the current user was removed, redirect user to # logout as per lin-hua-cheng's comment above. if request.user.id == user_obj.id: self.success_url = LOGOUT_URL # NOTE(dlapsley): if the current user was removed, redirect user to # logout as per lin-hua-cheng's comment above. if request.user.id == user_obj.id: self.success_url = LOGOUT_URL def get_success_url(self, request=None): # NOTE(dlapsley): if the current user was removed, redirect user to # logout as per lin-hua-cheng's comment above. if self.success_url == LOGOUT_URL: return reverse(LOGOUT_URL)

commit_message:
Applied patch to sort network topology order

As it is said on the bug description the fix was already available on
a Github repo, I wrote the author and we agreed on submit a new
patch in here with this change. I just did an small refactoring
regarding to PEP8, and adapting the algorithm to Python 3.

Change-Id: If20e19c5d89ef4c28983471822a19a4f17400062
Closes-Bug: #1234950
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Fox <Kevin.Fox@pnnl.gov>

commit_message:
Enable pagination for images view

This feature is already implemented, but not enabled because it
has strange behavior when the image list is filtered by removing aki
and ari type of images.

Since the filtering image code will be removed in:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59935/

The pagination for images view should be enabled

Change-Id: Ice6eb133a817bea9c9f9adf0c2630968102f0d16
Closes-Bug: #1252649

commit_message:
And check for flavor extras cpu_period

Flavor extras cpu_period has a range [1000, 1000000].
Now there is no check about the value.

And then if you create an instance using this flavor,
it will get a exception: unsupported configuration:
Value of cputune period must be in range [1000, 1000000]

Change-Id: Ia774db2baf87f7ce94ebc0649daf14aa876bc818
Closes-Bug: #1327061
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/12/98312/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_value_right(key): if int(key)>=1000 and int(key)<=1000000: return True return False value = cleaned_data.get('value', "") elif keys == 'quota:cpu_period' and not is_value_right(value): msg = _('unsupported configuration: Value of cputune ' 'period must be in range [1000, 1000000].') self._errors["value"] = self.error_class([msg]) def clean(self): cleaned_data = super(EditExtraSpec, self).clean() key = cleaned_data.get('key', None) value = cleaned_data.get('value', "") if key == 'quota:cpu_period' and not is_value_right(value): msg = _('unsupported configuration: Value of cputune ' 'period must be in range [1000, 1000000].') self._errors["value"] = self.error_class([msg]) return cleaned_data

commit_message:
Handle requests for nova and cinder quota usage independently

   - Wrap requests in try/except clauses
   - Return default values for failed requests
   - Log failed requests
   - Code review updates

Change-Id: I6f9b6ec9fee601d0110b1113025d3b36b27d45bb
Partial-Bug: #1249330
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/70/80770/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for quota in get_tenant_quota_data( request, disabled_quotas=disabled_quotas): # Get nova quotas. flavors, instances, floating_ips = get_nova_quotas(request, usages) # Get cinder quotas. volumes, snapshots = get_cinder_quotas(request, disabled_quotas, usages)def get_nova_quotas(request, usages): """Retrieve the list of servers (available and deleted) and their IPs for the given request from Nova. If a request fails, then return the default value and log the error. """ floating_ips = _get_nova_floating_ips(request) flavors = _get_nova_flavors(request) instances = _get_nova_instances(request) flavors = _get_nova_missing_flavors(request, flavors, instances) usages.tally('instances', len(instances)) usages.tally('floating_ips', len(floating_ips)) return flavors, instances, floating_ips def get_cinder_quotas(request, disabled_quotas, usages): if 'volumes' in disabled_quotas: return [], [] try: volumes = cinder.volume_list(request) except Exception: volumes = [] msg = "Unable to retrieve cinder volumes list for request %r" LOG.exception(msg % request) try: snapshots = cinder.volume_snapshot_list(request) except Exception: snapshots = [] msg = "Unable to retrieve cinder snapshots list for request %r" LOG.exception(msg % request) usages.tally('gigabytes', sum([int(v.size) for v in volumes])) usages.tally('volumes', len(volumes)) usages.tally('snapshots', len(snapshots)) return volumes, snapshots def _get_nova_floating_ips(request): try: floating_ips = network.tenant_floating_ip_list(request) except Exception: floating_ips = [] msg = "Unable to retrieve floating IPs for request %r" LOG.exception(msg % request) return floating_ips def _get_nova_flavors(request): try: flavors = dict([(f.id, f) for f in nova.flavor_list(request)]) except Exception: flavors = [] msg = "Unable to retrieve the available instances sizes for request %r" LOG.exception(msg % request) return flavors def _get_nova_instances(request): try: instances, more_instances = nova.server_list(request) except Exception: instances = [] msg = "Unable to retrieve the list of servers for request %r" LOG.exception(msg % request) return instances def _get_nova_missing_flavors(request, flavors, instances): # Fetch deleted flavors if necessary. missing_flavors = [instance.flavor['id'] for instance in instances if instance.flavor['id'] not in flavors] for missing in missing_flavors: if missing not in flavors: try: flavors[missing] = nova.flavor_get(request, missing) except Exception: flavors[missing] = {} msg = "Unable to retrieve deleted instance for request %r" LOG.exception(msg % request) return flavors
deleted_lines: for quota in get_tenant_quota_data(request, disabled_quotas=disabled_quotas): # Get our usages. floating_ips = network.tenant_floating_ip_list(request) flavors = dict([(f.id, f) for f in nova.flavor_list(request)]) instances, has_more = nova.server_list(request) # Fetch deleted flavors if necessary. missing_flavors = [instance.flavor['id'] for instance in instances if instance.flavor['id'] not in flavors] for missing in missing_flavors: if missing not in flavors: try: flavors[missing] = nova.flavor_get(request, missing) except Exception: flavors[missing] = {} exceptions.handle(request, ignore=True) usages.tally('instances', len(instances)) usages.tally('floating_ips', len(floating_ips)) if 'volumes' not in disabled_quotas: volumes = cinder.volume_list(request) snapshots = cinder.volume_snapshot_list(request) usages.tally('gigabytes', sum([int(v.size) for v in volumes])) usages.tally('volumes', len(volumes)) usages.tally('snapshots', len(snapshots))

subject: Support for cisco DFA in horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-28 19:02:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/21d3f2335283025de34bd6d1099a1c98d1591930', 'message': 'Implements: blueprint cisco DFA support in horizon

Change-Id: I1e5694971faf09ab96ed25b5044e40765720b43b
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-28 21:29:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/17d214a7b87077747f8912147fb1ae69f822f686', 'message': "Initial commit to support Cisco DFA in horizon

To support cisco Dynamic Fabric Automation (DFA) requirement,
a new option should be displayed when a network is created.
The new option is called 'configuration profile'. In order to conditionally
execute the changes for cisco DFA, a new flag will be added to
OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK, i.e. cisco_dfa_support.
If the flag is True, the 'configuration profile' will be displayed along with
other options when creating a network and user can select one of the available
profile from a list. The list of profiles are fetched from the newly added
database. The database is getting populated by a driver which will be added as
part of ML2 cisco DFA mechanism driver.

The link below has detail information regarding cisco DFA:
www.cisco.com/go/dfa

Implements: blueprint horizon-cisco-dfa-support

Change-Id: I1e5694971faf09ab96ed25b5044e40765720b43b

a new option should be displayed when a network is created.
The new option is called 'configuration profile'. In order to conditionally
execute the changes for cisco DFA, a new flag will be added to
OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK, i.e. cisco_dfa_support.

commit_message:
Support for cisco DFA in horizon

To support cisco Dynamic Fabric Automation (DFA) requirement,
a new option should be displayed when a network is created.
The new option is called 'configuration profile'. In order to conditionally
execute the changes for cisco DFA, a new flag will be added to
OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK, i.e. 'cisco-dfa'.
If the flag is True, the 'configuration profile' will be displayed along with
other options when creating a network and user can select one of the available
profile from a list. The list of profiles are fetched from the newly added
database. The database is getting populated by a driver which will be added as
part of ML2 cisco DFA mechanism driver.

The link below has detail information regarding cisco DFA:
www.cisco.com/go/dfa

Implements: blueprint horizon-cisco-dfa-support

Change-Id: I1e5694971faf09ab96ed25b5044e40765720b43b

commit_message:
Sparklines for instance table in horizon

Extends instance table in horizon to show sparklines for the power state of each instance sourced by the 'instance' meter

Implements: blueprint sparklines

Change-Id: I3b5447c35231604f0826a25322bdbf43fb59ce2c

commit_message:
Breakdown forms in a dedicated file

In order to improve the maintainability of the less files,
a breakdown is needed. This patch separates the forms definition
from the rest of the style.

Co-Authored-By: woodm1979 <matt.wood@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maxime Vidori <maxime.vidori@enovance.com>
Authored-By: Maxime Vidori <maxime.vidori@enovance.com>
Author: Maxime Vidori <maxime.vidori@enovance.com>

Note:  For some reason, I'm showing up as the author for this commit.  I
don't understand how that happened.  For now, I'll make sure I list
Maxime as a co-author to make sure he gets some credit.

Note:  Patch Set 12 is a reset, I started over from scratch because of
       rebase-hell.

Change-Id: Idc5da55a7376962d7c344dea87b7a64717ddd860
Partially-Implements: blueprint css-breakdown
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/28/103528/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/ /* Horizon Forms /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/ .modal, .login, .alert-actions, table, .static_page, .left { form { margin-bottom: 0; } } form { label { text-align: left; color: @gray; font-weight: bold; display: inline-block; } &.horizontal { .form-field { float: left; } &.split_half .form-field { width: 334px; /* Fits 2 fields to a row */ } &.split_quarter .form-field { width: 167px; /* Fits 4 fields to a row */ } &.split_five .form-field { width: 133px; /* Fits 5 fields to a row */ } fieldset { width: 100%; } } }

commit_message:
Fixes Swift object url encoding issue when name has spaces

* Removes quoting the container and object name before
  sending the request to Django. Django url resolve does the
  url encoding starting version 1.6.

Change-Id: Idbf6bcb22c28c51be59ea950e428382482f7bc76
Closes-Bug: #1336603

commit_message:
Add translation layer from django

Added translation layer allows to test different language mutations
without breaking code when explicitly specifying string related to the
current language mutation.To change language do:
import django.utils.translation as tr
tr.activate('de')  # this will change language to German

Locale files are gathered from openstack_dashboard/locale and
horizon/locale, those locales must by compiled first, therefore i
add message compilation before the execution of integration tests.

This patch does not manipulate with horizon language setting, it only
uses django translation module for obtaining string translations.

Every new patch should use the ugettext function as described in
loginpage.py, projectpage.py ...

Simple change language test was added.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: If43bb29a5dec75caa6ad42d484654182a99bd62d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/51/101951/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.translation import ugettext as _ self._page_title = _('Instance Overview')

subject: For Trove panels, stop requiring Swift in catalog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 23:32:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/dc7db6ad36cf3a2015134eedcd5edfcc57e99416', 'message': "For Trove panels, stop requiring Swift in catalog

* Remove permission checks for 'openstack.services.object-store' in
  Trove panels
* Stop using containers panel for downloading backups (which checks for
  'openstack.services.object-store' permission and additionally uses
  Swift from catalog); instead use swiftclient directly built from
  backup's locationRef

Closes-Bug: #1276814
Change-Id: Ie6e04c4e44090db082ce14e0cd8a178ab0d3c214

* Remove permission checks for 'openstack.services.object-store' in
  Trove panels
* Stop using containers panel for downloading backups (which checks for
  'openstack.services.object-store' permission and additionally uses
  Swift from catalog); instead use swiftclient directly built from

commit_message:
For Trove panels, stop requiring Swift in catalog

* Provide flag (TROVE_BACKUPS) with 3 choices: on, off, or consult
  catalog.
    * If value is True, backup-related panels are shown.
    * If value is False, backup-related panels are hidden.
    * If value is 'catalog', consult catalog (legacy behavior).
* Moves download backup to Actions column instead of dedicated column.
* Stop using containers panel for downloading backups (which checks
  'openstack.services.object-store' permission and additionally uses
  Swift from catalog); instead use swiftclient directly built from
  backup's locationRef

Closes-Bug: #1276814
Change-Id: Ie6e04c4e44090db082ce14e0cd8a178ab0d3c214

commit_message:
angularJS workflow for launching heat stacks

  - replaces django multi-step form view with angular wizard
  - allows for multiple file uploads, client side file downloads
    etc. Fixes issues with file locations & environment files
  - removes support for URL template files
  - requires a custom heatclient from here:
      o https://github.com/jsomara/python-heatclient/tree/envfiles
    if this becomes a blocking issue, we can add that method to horizon
    temporarily. The other possibility is that it is extended to support
    nested stacks as well (a Juno goal). This patch includes this code
    inside horizon, with the intention of removing it when support becomes
    available in upstream python-heatclient
  - there are outstanding messaging improvements (error messages, etc) that
    this patch could take advantage of for better message dialogs

To test this, check out sample environment & template files here. You'll
notice that the referenced file in the environment will get added in
stage2 of the wizard. If you don't have any file references to resolve,
it will go straight to stage3.
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example2_server_with_volume_nested/server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/env_server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/server_with_volume_env.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1322258
Partial-Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/heat-nested-stack
Change-Id: I99b21d4b73375229a2abca346342bfe948098e5f

commit_message:
Support of multiple plural forms in BatchActions

Horizon only supports singular and one plural form, when there are
languages as Polish and Russian that have more than one plural
form.
Then, this patch creates the function get_data_type_display_name in
BatchAction and its inherited classes to let translators to
manage multiple plural forms.

Change-Id: Ie63552034878b4ae59ff4b7853955341e5fb30e0
Closes-Bug:#1253174

commit_message:
session time out problem on the login page

The reproduce step cannot always make it. sometimes it doesn't work
as reported. I have made some changes and will continue working on
it.

Fixes Bug#1302367

Change-Id: Iebd4defbf8bc913607a43cf02edbf5c7335fc296

Extending quota mechanism to support neutron
LBaaS entities. Adding quota for vips, pools, members
and health monitors.

Added new function to check if LBaaS extension is supported,
using the new function for disabling LBaaS quotas.

Changed the quota retrieving function (usage.quotas.get_tenant_quota_data)
to get all neutron quotas and not only the floating ip.

Added new unit tests for testing neutron quotas retrieval
for cases when neutron quotas/security_groups/lbaas extensions
are enabled/disabled

This is one of four changes related to the BP.
This one is for horizon/openstack-dashboard project.
Another one is for neutron project,

and another one for tempest project.

to get all neutron quotas and not only the floating ip.

Added new unit tests for testing neutron quotas retrieval
for cases when neutron quotas/security_groups/lbaas extensions
are enabled/disabled

This is one of four changes related to the BP.
This one is for horizon/openstack-dashboard project.
Another one is for neutron project,
another one for python-neutronclient
and another one for tempest project.

See blueprint neutron-quota-extension for another three changes.
See horizon bug opened for following the BP: bug #1284107

commit_message:
Extending quota support for neutron LBaaS entities

Extending quota mechanism to support neutron
LBaaS entities. Adding quota for vips, pools, members
and health monitors.

Added new function to check if LBaaS extension is supported,
using the new function for disabling LBaaS quotas.

Changed the quota retrieving function (usage.quotas.get_tenant_quota_data)
to get all neutron quotas and not only the floating ip.

Added new unit tests for testing neutron quotas retrieval
for cases when neutron quotas/security_groups/lbaas extensions
are enabled/disabled

This is one of four changes related to the BP.
This one is for horizon/openstack-dashboard project.
Another one is for neutron project,
another one for python-neutronclient
and another one for tempest project.

See blueprint neutron-quota-extension for another three changes.
See horizon bug opened for following the BP: bug #1284107

Change-Id: I74e5b6c0451538aa6721a8ed1acbea673ac533b3
Implements: blueprint neutron-quota-extension
Closes-Bug: #1284107

commit_message:
volume limits and floating ip  graphic label consistency

Change the label over bargraph in create
volume and allocate floating ip modals.

"Number of Volumes -------1 of 2 Used"
"Total Gigabytes ---------1 of 1,000 GB Used"
"Floating IP -------------0 of 10 Used"

Change-Id: I059533973acd9885db3e748a218a842b43653ac0
Closes-Bug: #1327299
Closes-Bug: #1331184

commit_message:
Error on log error messages

Both cinderclient and troveclient don't raise an error when they fail to
connect -- they just emit a warning. That means, that when someone
forgets to mock the calls for them in the tests, the tests still pass,
but spam a lot of messages to the console. This patch makes the tests
fail in such a situation, by defining a logging handler that raises an
exception.

Change-Id: Ib098b0d33cdb047934018acc9819bc841e0b4689
Closes-bug: #1335082

commit_message:
Fixes policy profile selection on create instance

This fix enables the drag and drop interface when Cisco N1K is enabled.
Code is also extended to allow selection of a policy profile on a
per-network basis, rather than just one.

Closes-Bug: 1292176
Change-Id: I235d7cee811634c731c5502315cab69aef980d8a

commit_message:
Exclude snapshots from images at instance launch

While creating the instance, instance snapshots appear in two
lists: 'boot from image' and 'boot from snapshot'. This fix is
to address that.

Change-Id: I6acddebe566b92128a3d338909ddb9d2375b675f
Closes-Bug: 1296627

commit_message:
Add domain select to admin network create form

This adds a domain select to the Admin -> Create Network form
if there are multiple enabled domains that contain enabled
projects. The domain select will narrow down the list of projects
that can be selected. In this scenario the list of projects are
also grouped by domain.

Closes-Bug: 1340873
Change-Id: I4d6ed9da049cc6ae7257a5d0b0c598350434ca52

commit_message:
Switch to keystoneclient Sessions

Replace the old-fashioned client creation to introduce sessions
and auth plugins.

Change-Id: I09afa57360ed15d00eff4b7a9542e9add76e7fb6
implements: bp/selectable-auth-method
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/72/132072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneclient.auth import base from keystoneclient import session as ksc_sessionimport requestsdef get_project_list(**kwargs): token_plugin = base.get_plugin_class('token') plugin_args = dict((o.dest, kwargs.get(o.dest)) for o in token_plugin.get_options()) verify = not kwargs.get('insecure') if 'insecure' in kwargs else False debug = kwargs.get('debug') if 'debug' in kwargs else False request_session = requests.session() plugin_args['auth_url'] = auth_url ks_auth = token_plugin(**plugin_args) ks_session = ksc_session.Session(auth=ks_auth, verify=verify, session=request_session) client = get_keystone_client().Client(session=ks_session, debug=debug) plugin_args['auth_url'] = auth_url ks_auth = token_plugin(**plugin_args) ks_session = ksc_session.Session(auth=ks_auth, verify=verify, session=request_session) client = get_keystone_client().Client(session=ks_session, debug=debug) # TODO(mhu) project listing is slightly different for federation

commit_message:
Integration tests - Volumes tests

I added the _click_on_volumes method to basepage, so that
it can be used by go_to_volumes_page method.

I added the go_to_volumes_page method to projectpage,
so that it can be used for navigating to volumes page.

I added below methods for volumes page:
volumesspage -
create_volume method
delete_volume method
extend_volume method
filter_volumes method
delete_all_volumes method

I added the below methods for test_volumes
test_volumes-
test_create_volume method
test_extend_volume method
test_filter_volume method
test_delete_all_volumes method

Partially implements blueprint: volumes-selenium

Change-Id: Ifd74790ef7153dfe52d9a064b2c3a4992b15c4cb

subject: Change default session backend to cached_db
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-06 14:26:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/ba0220073708b98fa5e7049610aadfc104d7b37c', 'message': 'hange default session backend to cached_db

Horizon needs more space to handle session data. With the Identity
API moving towards V3 (that has a significantly enlarged token),
we need to work with sessions beyond 4KB.
Between the types of session backend offered by Django, we decided
to opt by the cached_db option. Possible benefits include:
* Unlimited session size
* Reduced traffic between client-server (smaller cookies)
* DB is more persistent and reliable than Memcache
* SQLite is embedded with Python

Change-Id: I585ff29ceef8d52e5baf3be1b6040572488897e1
Closes-bug: 1382079

commit_message:
Change default session backend to cached_db

Horizon needs more space to handle session data. With the Identity
API moving towards V3 (that has a significantly enlarged token),
we need to work with sessions beyond 4KB.
Between the types of session backend offered by Django, we decided
to opt by the cached_db option. Possible benefits include:
* Unlimited session size
* Reduced traffic between client-server (smaller cookies)
* DB is more persistent and reliable than Memcache
* SQLite is embedded with Python

Change-Id: I585ff29ceef8d52e5baf3be1b6040572488897e1
Closes-bug: 1382079
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/50/133050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.cached_db'

commit_message:
Replace horizon alerting with an angular one

    Horizon alerting is now fully integrated into the angular
application. The object horizon.msg is available in the application
in order to keep the compatibility, it is a link to the new angular
service object.

Change-Id: I95c8b9b38843db9ecbc625b02fcd696b6981bd7b
Implements: blueprint horizon-angular

commit_message:
Partial fix missing keyboard focus from Console's iframe

The iframe in Instance Console doesn't get focus on loading, so the user
cannot type into the console, this change is focusing the iframe on
hovering mouse over it.

Partial-Bug: #1389117
Change-Id: I39fb5a26645d3805070a875386ec91b8048b8c79
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/81/132981/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $('iframe#console_embed').live('mouseover', function () { this.focus(); } );

subject: Make table columns configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-21 10:47:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/8131db8b1282b6eac07f9273963f7eec8df860b5', 'message': "Make table columns configurable

Add the possibility to configure visible table columns, by adding
an action button to the list of table's actions. Clicking on this button
opens a modal form dialog which makes it possible to choose the
table columns to display. The choice of columns is then saved to the
session as well as to a cookie.

When the table is rendered, the selected columns configuration is
retrieved from session or from the cookie if nothing is found in the
session. Taking into account this configuration, the table is then
rendered, displaying only the selected columns. If no configuration
is found in either session or the cookie, all columns are displayed.

The JSON format used for storing the selected columns configuration is
as follows. An entry with a key name of 'columns' is inserted to the
session and a cookie with the same name is created. The value of the
entry takes the following format:

{
    'table': ['list', 'of', 'selected', 'columns'],
    'another_table': ['columns', 'for', 'second', 'table']
}

E.g:

{
    'instances': ['name', 'size', 'status'],
    'images': ['name, 'image_type', 'protected']
}

To make this possible, a view (``horizon.views.ColumnsView``), a form
(``horizon.forms.ColumnsForm``) and a table action
(``horizon.tables.actions.ColumnsAction``) have been added to Horizon.
In order to enable column selection for a particular table, a few
additions are necessary:

1) A url to map to the view in step 2
2) A view to handle displaying the form for column selection.
   Needs to inherit from ``horizon.views.ColumnsView``
3) A form to handle the column selection. Needs to inherit from
   ``horizon.forms.ColumnsForm``
4) An action to handle the columns selection. Needs to inherit from
   ``horizon.tables.actions.ColumnsAction`` and needs to be added
   to the ``table_actions`` attribute of the table's ``Meta`` class.

To illustrate this newly added capability, the columns selection has
been enabled for the tables on the Host Aggregates panel on Admin
dashboard. The ability to select columns will be added to the rest of
the tables in a following patch.

Partially implements blueprint: configure-table-columns
Change-Id: Ida4fb0f959c8f80e5c5befc235df50834a183d95
