Add the possibility to configure visible table columns, by adding
an action button to the list of table's actions. Clicking on this button
opens a modal form dialog which makes it possible to choose the
table columns to display. The choice of columns is then saved to the
session as well as to a cookie.

When the table is rendered, the selected columns configuration is
retrieved from session or from the cookie if nothing is found in the
session. Taking into account this configuration, the table is then
rendered, displaying only the selected columns. If no configuration
is found in either session or the cookie, all columns are displayed.

To illustrate this newly added capability, the columns selection has
been enabled for the tables on the Host Aggregates panel on Admin
dashboard. The ability to select columns will be added to the rest of
the tables in a following patch.

Partially implements blueprint: configure-table-columns

commit_message:
Make table columns configurable

Add the possibility to configure visible table columns, by adding
an action button to the list of table's actions. Clicking on this button
opens a modal form dialog which makes it possible to choose the
table columns to display. The choice of columns is then saved to the
session as well as to a cookie.

When the table is rendered, the selected columns configuration is
retrieved from session or from the cookie if nothing is found in the
session. Taking into account this configuration, the table is then
rendered, displaying only the selected columns. If no configuration
is found in either session or the cookie, all columns are displayed.

To illustrate this newly added capability, the columns selection has
been enabled for the tables on the Host Aggregates panel on Admin
dashboard. The ability to select columns will be added to the rest of
the tables in a following patch.

Partially implements blueprint: configure-table-columns
Change-Id: Ida4fb0f959c8f80e5c5befc235df50834a183d95

commit_message:
Natural sort the instance name in all tables and tabs

In a few cases, the data to be sorted was a list of dicts or a list of
strings instead of a list of objects.  Previously, natural_sort() only
accepted an attribute name, so in order to make it more flexible to
handle this scenario it now accepts as its single optional argument a
getter function.

Closes-Bug: #1329954
Change-Id: Ie49e6f6f746764585ff711400f7a9c63a76c4a25

commit_message:
Network Tab does not show external network column

Modified the network tab to have new column
'External Network' in admin dashboard and
project dashboard by modifying the NetworksTable
class in tables.py

It is confusing to just have only shared column
and not external network yes/no

Modified the column name to 'External' as per review comments

Closes-bug: #1350237
Change-Id: Id5c4783de9f80ab6bf4fc50270ac7f1711f1cbfa

commit_message:
Allow filtering on instance status using translated values

This allows for a tuple of filter values to be used for selecting
a filter value for any given filter field in a table. This way the
selected filter value can be translated while the actual filter
value used is a known constant. This is implemented for the Status
filter on the instances tables.

Change-Id: I48845c25c49b30b8dfdb27ff12f29779d0dade32
Closes-Bug: #1365754

commit_message:
Mark host down for maintenance

Implement host maintenance in the hypervisors panel.
On each compute host a maintenance button was added.
This button enable/disable the compute host for future
maintenance.

Implements: blueprint mark-host-down-for-maintenance

Change-Id: I7dbfdbec16054c53704eb4dd56689ba9c12e34da
Co-Authored-By: Juan M. Olle <juan.m.olle@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/27/103627/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack_dashboard import api def is_deleting(instance): task_state = getattr(instance, "OS-EXT-STS:task_state", None) if not task_state: return False return task_state.lower() == "deleting"class DisableMaintenanceHost(tables.BatchAction): name = "disableMaintenance" action_present = _("Disable") action_past = _("Host disabled for maintenance") data_type_singular = _("Host") data_type_plural = _("Hosts") classes = ('btn-migrate', 'btn-danger') def allowed(self, request, instance=None): return instance._info["status"] == "enabled" def action(self, request, obj_id): api.nova.disable_service_host(request, obj_id,) class EnableMaintenanceHost(tables.BatchAction): name = "enableMaintenance" action_present = _("Enable") action_past = _("Enabled") data_type_singular = _("Host") data_type_plural = _("Hosts") classes = ('btn-migrate', 'btn-danger') def allowed(self, request, instance=None): return instance._info["status"] == "disabled" def action(self, request, obj_id): api.nova.enable_service_host(request, obj_id,) row_actions = (EvacuateHost, EnableMaintenanceHost, DisableMaintenanceHost,)

commit_message:
Support local time for horizon.d3linechart.js

By default time in metering chart will use local time and
add a swicth for using UTC time, many ops need local time
incluing me:)

Change-Id: I5acb3af15ce09b99ce274bcbccafb446dec0c0c5
Close-Bug: 1326595
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/55/98055/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* Convert UTC time to local time */ self.convert_to_local_time = function(date){ var d = new Date(date); utc = d.getTime(); utc_offset = -d.getTimezoneOffset() * 60000; local_time_utc = utc + utc_offset return local_time_utc } statistic.x = self.convert_to_local_time(statistic.x) statistic.x = statistic.x / 1000; var date = '' + new Date(x * 1000)..toLocaleString() + ''; graph: graph, timeFixture: new Rickshaw.Fixtures.Time.Local()
deleted_lines: statistic.x = d3.time.format('%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S').parse(statistic.x); statistic.x = statistic.x.getTime() / 1000; var date = '' + new Date(x * 1000).toUTCString() + ''; graph: graph

commit_message:
Add pagination support on objects

Add a specific objects's marker
Remove GET action while deleting container or object
only when a marker is used
Add test units

Closes-Bug: 1249118
Change-Id: I8824f662b18d8737b82af538a29151c85cf6ad28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/58/137758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.create_stubs({utils: ('get_page_size', )}) def test_swift_get_object_pagination(self): page_size = 20 container = self.containers.first() objects = self.objects.list() swift_api = self.stub_swiftclient() utils.get_page_size(IsA(http.HttpRequest)).AndReturn(page_size) swift_api.get_container(container.name, limit=page_size + 1, marker=None, prefix=None, delimiter='/', full_listing=False).AndReturn((None, objects)) self.mox.ReplayAll() (objs, more) = api.swift.swift_get_objects(self.request, container.name, marker=None, paginate=True) self.assertEqual(len(objs), len(objects)) self.assertFalse(more) @test.create_stubs({utils: ('get_page_size', )}) def test_swift_get_object_pagination_more(self): page_size = 1 container = self.containers.first() objects = self.objects.list() swift_api = self.stub_swiftclient() utils.get_page_size(IsA(http.HttpRequest)).AndReturn(page_size) swift_api.get_container(container.name, limit=page_size + 1, marker=None, prefix=None, delimiter='/', full_listing=False) \ .AndReturn((None, objects[:page_size + 1])) self.mox.ReplayAll() (objs, more) = api.swift.swift_get_objects(self.request, container.name, prefix=None, marker=None, paginate=True) self.assertEqual(len(objs), page_size) self.assertTrue(more) @override_settings(API_RESULT_LIMIT=2) def test_swift_get_object_pagination_disabled(self): limit = getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_LIMIT', 2) container = self.containers.first() objects = self.objects.list() swift_api = self.stub_swiftclient() swift_api.get_container(container.name, limit=limit + 1, marker=None, prefix=None, delimiter='/', full_listing=True) \ .AndReturn((None, objects[:limit + 1])) self.mox.ReplayAll() (objs, more) = api.swift.swift_get_objects(self.request, container.name, marker=None, paginate=False) self.assertEqual(len(objs), limit) self.assertFalse(more)

commit_message:
WIP Angularize identity modal forms

This is a WIP prototype of the identity modal forms.
The prototype is to reuse hz.table.js as the base module and build
the modal controllers on top of it. Currently it is partially done as
some of the REST API is still missing.

Partially Implements: blueprint 133767
Change-Id: I27c0843483fd8ffdc2f4a6666920f354be8b2048

commit_message:
Separate jasmine tests between services and controllers

    The separation allow to correctly test services in a dedicated jasmine
environment and test controllers without taking care of which dependency needs
to be loaded.

Change-Id: I96582efe209b3206b150b86f2fb3e5632e7e8c14
Closes-Bug: 1394234
Co-Authored-By: Ambroise Christea <ambroise.christea@cloudwatt.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-18 10:13:30.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/projects/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/9ca06fc266ea244977aea192e46f5764954157b8', 'message': 'A project shouldn't be deleted when there are instances running

Initially the admin user was able to delete a tenant even if
it had instances associated with it. This fix will throw the
error ("Failed to delete tenant <tenant_id>. There are instances
associated with it. Please delete the instances and try again."),
if a tenant has instances associated with it. The tenant will
only get deleted if no instance(s) is associated with it.

Change-Id: Ia6fd76b99454516e4a8966b58a9262962c9b3ec0
Closes-Bug: #1288230
'}]
commit_message:
A project shouldn't be deleted when there are instances running

Initially the admin user was able to delete a tenant even if
it had instances associated with it. This fix will throw the
error ("Failed to delete tenant <tenant_id>. There are instances
associated with it. Please delete the instances and try again."),
if a tenant has instances associated with it. The tenant will
only get deleted if no instance(s) is associated with it.

Change-Id: Ia6fd76b99454516e4a8966b58a9262962c9b3ec0
Closes-Bug: #1288230

' There are instances associated with it.' ' Please delete the instances and try again.') % project raise exceptions.Conflict(msg)

commit_message:
doc: Split settings page into sub sections

Settings page is already big enough. This commit splits
the settings page into several pages. It focuses on splitting
and is intended to have no actual change.

Change-Id: I80bb31d2941e70a28db4a26467358f8fba8e8256
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/78/125278/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================ Horizon Settings ================ The following options are available in order to configure/customize the behavior of your Horizon installation. All of them are contained in the ``HORIZON_CONFIG`` dictionary. .. _dashboards: -------------- ``dashboards`` -------------- .. versionadded:: 2012.1(Essex) Default: ``None`` Horizon Dashboards are automatically discovered in the following way: * By traversing Django's list of `INSTALLED_APPS <https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.4/ref/settings/#std:setting-INSTALLED_APPS>`_ and importing any files that have the name ``"dashboard.py"`` and include code to register themselves as a Horizon dashboard. * By adding a configuration file to the ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory (for more information see :ref:`pluggable-settings-label`). By default, these dashboards are ordered alphabetically. However, if a list of dashboard slugs is provided in this setting, the supplied ordering is applied to the list of discovered dashboards. If the list of dashboard slugs is shorter than the number of discovered dashboards, the remaining dashboards are appended in alphabetical order. The dashboards listed must be in a Python module which is included in the ``INSTALLED_APPS`` list and on the Python path. --------------------- ``default_dashboard`` --------------------- .. versionadded:: 2012.1(Essex) Default: ``None`` The slug of the dashboard which should act as the first-run/fallback dashboard whenever a user logs in or is otherwise redirected to an ambiguous location. ------------- ``user_home`` ------------- .. versionadded:: 2012.1(Essex) Default: ``settings.LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL`` This can be either a literal URL path (such as the default), or Python's dotted string notation representing a function which will evaluate what URL a user should be redirected to based on the attributes of that user. -------------------- ``ajax_queue_limit`` -------------------- .. versionadded:: 2012.1(Essex) Default: ``10`` The maximum number of simultaneous AJAX connections the dashboard may try to make. This is particularly relevant when monitoring a large number of instances, volumes, etc. which are all actively trying to update/change state. ---------------------- ``ajax_poll_interval`` ---------------------- .. versionadded:: 2012.1(Essex) Default: ``2500`` How frequently resources in transition states should be polled for updates, expressed in milliseconds. ------------ ``help_url`` ------------ .. versionadded:: 2012.2(Folsom) Default: ``None`` If provided, a "Help" link will be displayed in the site header which links to the value of this settings (ideally a URL containing help information). -------------- ``exceptions`` -------------- .. versionadded:: 2012.1(Essex) Default: ``{'unauthorized': [], 'not_found': [], 'recoverable': []}`` A dictionary containing classes of exceptions which Horizon's centralized exception handling should be aware of. Based on these exception categories, Horizon will handle the exception and display a message to the user. ---------------------- ``password_validator`` ---------------------- .. versionadded:: 2012.1(Essex) Default: ``{'regex': '.*', 'help_text': _("Password is not accepted")}`` A dictionary containing a regular expression which will be used for password validation and help text which will be displayed if the password does not pass validation. The help text should describe the password requirements if there are any. This setting allows you to set rules for passwords if your organization requires them. ------------------------- ``password_autocomplete`` ------------------------- .. versionadded:: 2013.1(Grizzly) Default: ``"on"`` Controls whether browser autocompletion should be enabled on the login form. Valid values are ``"on"`` and ``"off"``. ------------------------ ``simple_ip_management`` ------------------------ .. versionadded:: 2013.1(Grizzly) Default: ``True`` Enable or disable simplified floating IP address management. "Simple" floating IP address management means that the user does not ever have to select the specific IP addresses they wish to use, and the process of allocating an IP and assigning it to an instance is one-click. The "advanced" floating IP management allows users to select the floating IP pool from which the IP should be allocated and to select a specific IP address when associating one with an instance. .. note:: Currently "simple" floating IP address management is not compatible with Neutron. There are two reasons for this. First, Neutron does not support the default floating IP pool at the moment. Second, a Neutron floating IP can be associated with each VIF and we need to check whether there is only one VIF for an instance to enable simple association support. ------------------- ``angular_modules`` ------------------- Default: ``[]`` A list of AngularJS modules to be loaded when Angular bootstraps. These modules are added as dependencies on the root Horizon application ``hz``. ------------ ``js_files`` ------------ Default: ``[]`` A list of javascript files to be included in the compressed set of files that are loaded on every page. This is needed for AngularJS modules that are referenced in ``angular_modules`` and therefore need to be include in every page.

added_lines:
{% trans "Object" %}: {% trans "An object is the basic storage entity that represents a file you store in the OpenStack Object Storage system. When you upload data to OpenStack Object Storage, the data is stored as-is (no compression or encryption) and consists of a location (container), the object's name, and any metadata consisting of key/value pairs." %}

{% trans "Pseudo-folder" %}: {% trans "Within a container you can group your objects into pseudo-folders, which behave similarly to folders in your desktop operating system, with the exception that they are virtual collections defined by a common prefix on the object's name. A slash (/) character is used as the delimiter for pseudo-folders in the Object Store." %}

commit_message:
Integration tests - Volumes tests

I added the _click_on_volumes method to basepage, so that
it can be used by go_to_volumes_page method.

I added the go_to_volumes_page method to projectpage,
so that it can be used for navigating to volumes page.

I added below methods for volumes page:
volumesspage -
create_volume method
delete_volume method
extend_volume method
filter_volumes method
delete_all_volumes method

I added the below methods for test_volumes
test_volumes-
test_create_volume method
test_extend_volume method
test_filter_volume method
test_delete_all_volumes method

Partially implements blueprint: volumes-selenium

Change-Id: Iacc4766b48524902d0c35673ea9e4025c9f04fb5

commit_message:
Show focus on left side navigation

This bug is an accessibility problem. Navigation focus is not visible
when using Tab-key to navigate.

This fix make focus clearly visible due to use contrast color.

Change-Id: I26072a1745f675bd418d6fd3b8920ab25ecedb15
Closes-Bug: 1315488

commit_message:
Clarify image creation comment about compressed image support

The previous comment about tar.gz support was misleading,
as tar.gz is not actually supported. The only thing that is
supported is uploading .gz'ed files as far as I can say.

Change-Id: Ifab9fc64c46998f3c924df445d804b91a8cef171
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/85/123085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% trans "Currently only images available via an HTTP URL are supported. The image location must be accessible to the Image Service. Compressed image binaries are supported (.zip and .gz.)" %}
deleted_lines: {% trans "Currently only images available via an HTTP URL are supported. The image location must be accessible to the Image Service. Compressed image binaries are supported (.zip and .tar.gz.)" %}

commit_message:
[WIP] Standardize the exception handling thrown by services.

So far the services that are handled are compute, network and image.
The decorator is wrap around the function calling a service API, it
catches all exceptions and generates the appropriate message. The
user can also customize the message at the declaration level.

Partialy Implements: blueprint improve-error-message-details-for-usability
Change-Id: Ib65b3918a9a38f9941904411345757b813e3c0de

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import novaclient from horizon import exceptions as horizon_exceptions from openstack_dashboard.api import exceptions from openstack_dashboard.test import helpers as test class ExceptionTests(test.APITestCase): def setUp(self): super(ExceptionTests, self).setUp() self.request.META['HTTP_X_REQUESTED_WITH'] = 'XMLHttpRequest' @exceptions.form_exception_handler() def _raise_compute_exception(self, request): raise novaclient.exceptions.ClientException() def test_compute_exception(self): self._raise_compute_exception(self.request) self.assertItemsEqual(self.request.horizon['async_messages'][0], ['error', u'Compute: Unknown Error', '']) @exceptions.form_exception_handler(compute_msg="My error msg") def _raise_custom_compute_exception(self, request): raise novaclient.exceptions.ClientException() def test_custom_compute_exception(self): self._raise_custom_compute_exception(self.request) self.assertItemsEqual(self.request.horizon['async_messages'][0], ['error', u'My error msg', '']) @exceptions.form_exception_handler(redirect='www.example.com') def _raise_compute_exception_redirect(self, request): raise novaclient.exceptions.ClientException() def test_compute_redirect(self): self.assertRaises(horizon_exceptions.Http302, self._raise_compute_exception_redirect, self.request)

commit_message:
Adds router create/delete integration tests

I have added test_router.py which tests create
router and delete router functionalities. To
allow this I have added routerpage.py with two methods
to create and delete router.Also added methods to
verify the status of newly created router.

Change-Id: If3e19d689ed3aec857c4e0b37aa1ef01c32a1427

commit_message:
Make the instance status in Network Topolgy translatable

Make the Status value in translatable.  In order to make sure
there aren't multiple translations for instance statuses, convert
all instance status translations to javascript.

This fix excludes translating the Port/Interface status.

Change-Id: Ib2459ef429aabac0ab811ba9b6b0a36f77e7dcc3
Partial-Bug: #1323599

commit_message:
Fixes session timeout string in horizon

1) This patch fixes the session timeout string problem which
occurs when users clicks on the UI and Ui redirects the
user to the login page but without session timeout message.

2) This patch also fixes other cases of unnecessary logout
messages.

Closes-Bug: #1231355

Change-Id: I9824db44382247d64cc8c399eb5e855e818e8781
(cherry picked from commit e940196a4386d51f9a9c2644cea28940da48f08b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/13/136813/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add help text for server type filter fields

This adds the help_text attribute to the FilterAction class which
can be used to display help text in a tooltip next to server type
filter fields. Help text is added for the admin images and instances
filters, and the project instances filter.

Closes-Bug: #1358909
Change-Id: Iffa68b8600839482f004d6d560ef9878ba892adf

commit_message:
Fix shared firewall policy can not be displayed in horizon

When firewall policy is set to shared, it should be seen by any
users just like public images.

_model_query function of common_db_minxin.py in neutron has used
shared and tenant_id fields restored from token to construct the
query condition, so continuing to pass tenant_id as filters
condition will cause sql confusion, just delete them to keep
consistent with the approach python-neutronclient did.

Change-Id: Ied91830cf080ab5f0ad78ca4d98396deec7817f8
Closes-bug: 1294541

commit_message:
Attach a floating ip to an created instance

Added the feature to attach to an new instance a floating ip
from the launch instance modal form. In the launch instance
form, the field 'floating ip' is added. It behaves exactly
like the field in 'associate floating ip' form.

Change-Id: I6faf67fa4edefb68eb50eb1d7d9681720cf36ac5
blueprint: launch-instance-floating-ip-allocation-association
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Soulas <cedric.soulas@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Add support for AZs to Trove inst-create workflow

Added new dropdown parameter to choose which AZ the Trove
instance to be created should go in. This is important for
HA scenarios since you want to be able to explicitly specify
the AZ for the database instance to create.

Change-Id: Ic92e5c87b0fac7bbbaddd7aecb33a3b6e401df81

commit_message:
Upgrade angular.js to v1.2.20

The current version in place in Horizon contains a bug that brakes
the validation for number input types in chrome
https://github.com/angular/angular.js/issues/2144
The new version contains the fix for the bug

Change-Id: If5ca8476e3410fb14d4fbd827c3d2bd2a296c280

Any changes to the data are automatically reflected * in the View without the need for a manual update. * * Two different declaration styles are included below: * * * one binds methods and properties directly onto the controller using `this`: * `ng-controller="SettingsController1 as settings"` * * one injects `$scope` into the controller: * `ng-controller="SettingsController2"` * * The second option is more common in the Angular community, and is generally used in boilerplates * and in this guide. * # Calling $http from outside AngularJS * The `$http` service will not actually send the request until the next `$digest()` is * executed. Normally this is not an issue, since almost all the time your call to `$http` will * be from within a `$apply()` block. * If you are calling `$http` from outside Angular, then you should wrap it in a call to * `$apply` to cause a $digest to occur and also to handle errors in the block correctly. * * ``` * $scope.$apply(function() { * $http(...); * }); * ``` * * When unit testing you are mostly responsible for scheduling the `$digest` cycle. If you do * not trigger a `$digest` before calling `$httpBackend.flush()` then the request will not have * been made and `$httpBackend.expect(...)` expectations will fail. The solution is to run the * code that calls the `$http()` method inside a $apply block as explained in the previous * section. * $scope.$apply(function() { * $http.get(...); * }); * Since all invocations of the $http service require passing in an HTTP method and URL, and * POST/PUT requests require request data to be provided as well, shortcut methods * were created: * * 
 *
* - {@link ng.$http#methods_get $http.get} * - {@link ng.$http#methods_head $http.head} * - {@link ng.$http#methods_post $http.post} * - {@link ng.$http#methods_put $http.put} * - {@link ng.$http#methods_delete $http.delete} * - {@link ng.$http#methods_jsonp $http.jsonp} * fashion. In addition, you can supply a `headers` property in the config object passed when * transformation functions to these properties directly without the array wrapper. * * `request`: interceptors get called with http `config` object. The function is free to * modify the `config` or create a new one. The function needs to return the `config` * directly or as a promise. * modify the `response` or create a new one. The function needs to return the `response` * directly or as a promise. * 
 * return config || $q.when(config); * return response || $q.when(response); * }; * } * // register the interceptor via an anonymous factory *

Shared Firewall Policies and Rules created

by admin are listed for tenants in CLI but
not visible in GUI. Changed code to fix it

Change-Id: I189fc0ad047deffd120bae08fb96ff4baf3558f3
Closes-bug: 1324496

commit_message:
Allow firewall rule with ANY protocol to be edited

If a Neutron FWaaS rule is created with protocol set to ANY, it cannot
be edited. This is because the rule update page doesn't handle the case
when rule's protocol value is None. The fix is to check the value and
assign it dropdown list selection entry as 'ANY' explicitly.

Change-Id: I724257d4091d0ef2fec4a0cdb47471f2d0c07de3
Closes-Bug: #1324382
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/54/96654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If 'protocol' is None, it means ANY protocol if kwargs['initial']['protocol']: protocol = kwargs['initial']['protocol'].upper() else: protocol = 'ANY' for tup in [('TCP', _('TCP')), ('UDP', _('UDP')), ('ICMP', _('ICMP')), ('ANY', _('ANY'))]:

commit_message:
Replace timeutils from openstack-common with oslo.utils

This patch drops the `timeutils` module added to horizon from
openstack-common in favor of `oslo.utils.timeutils`

oslo.utils is a new package where some graduated utilities are going to be
maintained.

Change-Id: I703f518721f9dab2166ba5702ccf25d399f240f6
Partially-Implements: blueprint improve-oslo-usage
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/26/113626/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set domain_context session variable

The domain_context and domain_context_name is set to the domain where
the token is scoped which is retreived depending on the scoping type
of the token.

Change-Id: Iee8605fdb5618ab67306cc27031d722a1771a4c6
Closes-Bug: #1338986
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/22/105422/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: request.session['domain_context'] = user.domain_id domain['id'], domain['name'] = self._get_current_domain(auth_ref) @staticmethod def _get_current_domain(auth_ref): """Retreive domain id, name from token.""" # A token can be scoped in either domain, project, trust or unscoped. if auth_ref.domain_scoped: return auth_ref.domain_id, auth_ref.domain_name elif auth_ref.project_scoped: return auth_ref.project_domain_id, auth_ref.project_domain_name # This is where unscoped token end up, we ignore trust scoped tokens. return auth_ref.user_domain_id, auth_ref.user_domain_name

commit_message:
Replacing data_processing with data-processing

Using data_processing when setting keystone static catalog causes Sahara
not to find the endpoint afterwards since keystone translates
data_processing to data-processing.

Change-Id: Ic4ef792a6c9ee7fe8b6f947c237be73782552c26
Partial-bug: #1356053

commit_message:
Add ability to set settings from a directory.

Add file in openstack_dashboard/local/settings/ and reference it in __init__.py like:
    from myfile import *
You can commit it in you own fork and can be used as base setting.

Closes-Bug: #1399580
Change-Id: If8419d30a510c006b53e314d3d8fdb6671c229b0

commit_message:
Preserve flavorid when updating Flavors

As described in blueprint edit-flavor-ui, Flavors are deleted and then
created instead of being modified.  However, flavorid should be
preserverd, because it is used to launch instances.  From Nova point of
view this is allowed and expected behavior.

Change-Id: I5ccafa9ff3d412c102458b77dc545cef340fdc64
Closes-Bug: #1291069
(cherry picked from commit bb6c60e2016597bc1e253a4e0a52242f17bfc417)

commit_message:
Preserve flavorid when updating Flavors

As described in blueprint edit-flavor-ui, Flavors are deleted and then
created instead of being modified.  However, flavorid should be
preserverd, because it is used to launch instances.  From Nova point of
view this is allowed and expected behavior.

Change-Id: I5ccafa9ff3d412c102458b77dc545cef340fdc64
Closes-Bug: #1291069
(cherry picked from commit bb6c60e2016597bc1e253a4e0a52242f17bfc417)

commit_message:
Snakeoil CA

A Certificate Manager plugin is very useful for development and testing
workflows.

Change-Id: I4b63564df8c200c3eea1dd62d15ce70b94f2956e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/81/141981/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== Snakeoil CA Certificate Manager Plugin ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/barbican-snakeoil-ca A certificate management plugin which auto approves all requests can be very useful for testing and development deployments. This is especially useful for tools (such as TripleO) which hope to use Barbican as an abstraction layer for certificate creation in production deployments but still require a configuration that will work in CI. Problem Description =================== In order to use the certificate management interface in a development or testing environment a user must (currently) configure dogtag or another backend in a way which auto-approves certificate requests. This is an unnecessary burden in many environments (such as CI pipelines) which require none of the advanced features these tools provide. Proposed Change =============== https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140575 Create a plugin which implements the certificate manager interface and will sign any certificate request sent to it. Allow for configuration of an on-disk CA certificate and key. If no certificate or key is found at that path, a new CA certificate and key will be created and stored at that path encoded in PEM file format. If no certificate or key path is specified then a new CA key and certificate will be created and stored only in memory. Alternatives ------------ What other ways could we do this thing? Why aren't we using those? This doesn't have to be a full literature review, but it should demonstrate that thought has been put into why the proposed solution is an appropriate one. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- TODO Security impact --------------- This feature is explicitly not intended for use in any type of production environment. This will be explicitly documented as such and is also named 'Snakeoil' to (hopefully) make this as apparent as possible. Notifications & Audit Impact ---------------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ This feature will require an on-disk lock in order to compute certificate serials. Because this is a reference and not a production feature the performance implications here are deemed acceptable. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. This feature should never be deployed to production. Developer impact ---------------- This should ease the setup of development environments for certificate management. We may want to consider documenting setting up this type of environment for new users. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: greghaynes <greg@greghaynes.net> Work Items ---------- Implement the plugin. This plugin will implement the general certificate request API so barbican-client work will be completed in that fashion. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== Documenting this feature for setting up development and testing environments could be useful but is not requried. References ==========

commit_message:
labs: fix setup_cinder_volumes.sh, again

The recently introduced AUTH variable does not get correctly set in
setup_cinder_volumes.sh.

This wouldn't get noticed for installations via ssh (because the path in
AUTH incorrectly expanding to "config//admin-openstackrc.sh" happens to
work via ssh), but it breaks installations using VirtualBox shared
folders.

Change-Id: Ic4308b9736b5d79ca06683dd6c96d7479fdf8a67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/46/149846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: AUTH="source $CONFIG_DIR/admin-openstackrc.sh"

commit_message:
Fix OCF chown for rabbitmq dirs

Then rabbitmq directories was already created and/or owned by a root,
rabbitmq would fail to start as it cannot access its PID file dir.

The solution is to check, if rabbitmq dirs exist and rabbit can write to
them. If it cannot, chown them

Closes-bug: #1405408

Change-Id: Ieed8b4ae1b83b20bde67a96a206453688cda38ef
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/33/143833/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local dir # Regardless of whether we just created the directory or it # already existed, check whether it is writable by the configured # user for dir in ${PID_DIR} "${OCF_RESKEY_mnesia_base}" "${OCF_RESKEY_log_dir}"; do if test -e ${dir}; then if ! su -s /bin/sh - $OCF_RESKEY_username -c "test -w ${dir}"; then ocf_log warn "Directory ${dir} is not writable by ${OCF_RESKEY_username}, chowning." chown -R ${OCF_RESKEY_username}:${OCF_RESKEY_groupname} "${dir}" fi fi done

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-12 19:51:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/25493c0c8d88fc71d76ce81b3e5f0c2de9937039', 'message': 'Add query property to threshold alarms.

Heat had fallen behind the evolution of the Ceilometer API.  The full
generality of the Ceilometer API for creating alarms was not available
through Heat templates.  In particular, the template author could
stipulate only matching metadata in the query for Samples; other very
interesting attributes, such as resource_id, could not be referenced
in alarm properties.

This change introduces a new property for OS::Ceilometer::Alarm,
namely "query".  The template can now specify a query property instead
of a matching_metadata property, and can thus reference anything that
can be referenced in a Ceilometer query.

The old matching_metadata property remains, and its constraints on
which samples to accept are combined with those from the query (if
any).

Note also that the python-ceilometerclient has a lot of backward
compatibility logic --- including accepting matching_metadata.  This
change adds all that logic into OS::Ceilometer::Alarm, so that it
becomes a proper client of the current Ceilometer API.

(cherry picked from commit a0ffafdf8eaa751b792c5f9628eac20a8800c8b5)

2. Fix legacy alarm matching_metadata broken by recent fix.
(cherry picked from commit bd3078e67812d51fa38dce17dd1009bad1613ad2)

commit_message:
Add query property to threshold alarms.

Heat had fallen behind the evolution of the Ceilometer API.  The full
generality of the Ceilometer API for creating alarms was not available
through Heat templates.  In particular, the template author could
stipulate only matching metadata in the query for Samples; other very
interesting attributes, such as resource_id, could not be referenced
in alarm properties.

This change introduces a new property for OS::Ceilometer::Alarm,
namely "query".  The template can now specify a query property instead
of a matching_metadata property, and can thus reference anything that
can be referenced in a Ceilometer query.

The old matching_metadata property remains, and its constraints on
which samples to accept are combined with those from the query (if
any).

Note also that the python-ceilometerclient has a lot of backward
compatibility logic --- including accepting matching_metadata.  This
change adds all that logic into OS::Ceilometer::Alarm, so that it
becomes a proper client of the current Ceilometer API.

Conflicts:

    heat/engine/resources/ceilometer/alarm.py

NOTE(mriedem): This backport removes the support_status code added
on master via commit 14bda35b528f9f2971769f036b53d1c0c6bab5bd since
that is a blueprint change which we shouldn't backport to stable
for a bug.

Closes-Bug: #1326721

(cherry picked from commit 0c50b7d23f5cd5c3cd0b35a563a6b602986d1c09)

NOTE(mriedem): There is a patch which this change depends on which
is squashed into this change:

1. Rework the way the matching metadata is created
(cherry picked from commit 03002393c03febe4559daf937f97c1e7c7fecc89)

And there are two changes which fix bugs introduced by the query
change which are squashed here:

1. Convert value type in alarm matching_metadata
(cherry picked from commit a0ffafdf8eaa751b792c5f9628eac20a8800c8b5)

2. Fix legacy alarm matching_metadata broken by recent fix.
(cherry picked from commit bd3078e67812d51fa38dce17dd1009bad1613ad2)

--

Change-Id: I0667db868c6f827867a5a20e4a3fa22fcad1a6a1

commit_message:
fix enabled parameter of update doesn't default to None

Currently, enabled parameter of v3.domains.update and v3.regions.update
defaults to True. It is easy to make mistakes and difficult to use.

Closes-Bug: #1413071
Change-Id: I8b392ff228691b2735b06747dcfb802d4c191a54

commit_message:
Support ilo_address and drac_address in addition to ipmi_address

Only IP addresses are supported, host names will be supported in 1.1.

Change-Id: I863a82f7e3f697cdaac1f44af993e9e1e0f04d63
Closes-Bug: #1408311

commit_message:
Disable security group for some neutron driver

Some driver may not support security groups, in which
case the driver may return 500 and causes a failure in Rally.

This commit checks whether the driver supports secgroup
when neutron networking is enabled when neutron driver
reports its extensions correctly, or the user may set
allow_secgroup to false in the context setting to disable secgroup.

Change-Id: Id310af070d09bdf21ecb865be11a55b65f0d3837

commit_message:
Add --remove option for fuel plugins

This deletes the plugin that was previously installed.
Optionally ==<version> can be specified as in:

fuel plugins --remove fuel_plugin_example==1.0.0

DocImpact
related to blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Change-Id: Ifece43df1cb83a78ccda5b017fb19904815ac560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/19/143819/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import shutil @classmethod def remove_plugin(cls, plugin_name, plugin_version, force=False): if not cls.validate_environment(): raise error.WrongEnvironmentError( 'Plugin can be removed only from master node.') checker = lambda p: p['name'] == plugin_name if plugin_version is not None: checker = lambda p: p['name'] == plugin_name and \ p['version'] == plugin_version plugins = filter(checker, cls.get_all_data()) if len(plugins) == 0: if plugin_version is None: raise error.BadDataException( 'Plugin {0} does not exist'.format(plugin_name) ) else: raise error.BadDataException( 'Plugin {0}, version {1} does not exist'.format( plugin_name, plugin_version) ) if len(plugins) > 1: if plugin_version is None: raise error.BadDataException( 'Multiple plugins {0} found. ' 'Consider adding ==<version>'.format(plugin_name) ) else: raise error.BadDataException( 'Multiple plugins {0} found.'.format(plugin_name) ) plugin = plugins[0] resp = cls.connection.delete_request( cls.class_instance_path.format(**plugin) ) plugin_path = os.path.join( EXTRACT_PATH, '{name}-{version}'.format(**plugin) ) shutil.rmtree(plugin_path) return resp

commit_message:
Support string flavor IDs

This allows operating on Nova flavors with non-integer ids
by adding a new str_id field to the view that always contains the
unicode flavor id.  The current id field will now contain a value
only when the flavor's id can be cast to int, otherwise it will be
None.  Validation of flavor id when querying a flavor or creating an
instance has been updated to include non-empty strings in addition to
integers.

This will require a patch to python-troveclient to properly fallback
to str_id in absence of the integer id:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123301/

Change-Id: Ie9cfefc6127bc76783cdf9668636342d7590b308
Closes-bug: #1333852

commit_message:
Basic conditional tasks capabilities

Added several examples of conditional tasks based on exsiting
expression parser. Currently only 2 models supported:
- cluster - cluster db model
- settings - cluster.attributes.editable field

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: Idff1644c9dcb7f217d9e8dbcf2a4ba4b9f0cb2d4

commit_message:
Do not hardcode datacentre as the physical network

Currently, setup-neutron's net creation code sets the
provider:physical_network property to 'datacentre' for VLAN'd networks.
This is incorrect, and in fact is a (somewhat) obvious regression from
the earlier VLAN code before the migration.

Change-Id: I677f3de70980d1db8cf64c822ad10e07368f928e
Closes-Bug: #1398457

commit_message:
On unicode data CSV exporter fails

Python CSV module is not supports unicode. Encoding added into CSV exporter.
Fixed config files definitions in manage_analytics.py

Closes-Bug: #1415026
Change-Id: I40ebc48e239c403f09ba7c18ba777e6216adf7cc

commit_message:
Fix docstring of get hierarchy methods

Replace "all" with "the" since the whole hierarchy
is not *always* returned by both methods.

commit_message:
Add support for identity_uri.

Kilo Neutron now sets a default value for identity_uri in
in the default config file. Packages may or may not remove
this default value... and it trumps all of the auth_host,
auth_port, auth_host, auth_admin_prefix settings we currently use
for our puppet-neutron defaults.

This patch adds the ability to set a new identity_uri parameter.
It also deprecates the old auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol,
and auth_admin_prefix parameters. Logic is in place so that
users of the deprecated settings should have a smooth upgrade
process and get deprecation warnings until they adopt the
new settings.

Change-Id: Ideefb4d824cbd5b4b83f9eb773a75e536e3458fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/54/147954/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (optional) DEPRECATED. The keystone host # Defaults to localhost.# (optional) DEPRECATED. The protocol used to access the auth host# (optional) DEPRECATED. The keystone auth port # Defaults to 35357.# Defaults to: false # # [*identity_uri*] # (optional) Complete admin Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to: false $identity_uri = false, $auth_host = 'localhost', $auth_port = '35357', $auth_protocol = 'http', $auth_admin_prefix = false, neutron_config { # if both auth_uri and identity_uri are set we skip these deprecated settings entirely if !$auth_uri or !identity_uri { if $auth_admin_prefix { warning('The auth_admin_prefix parameter is deprecated. Please use auth_uri and identity_uri instead.') validate_re($auth_admin_prefix, '^(/.+[^/])?$') neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_admin_prefix': value => $auth_admin_prefix; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_admin_prefix': value => $auth_admin_prefix; } } else { neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_admin_prefix': ensure => absent; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_admin_prefix': ensure => absent; } } if $auth_host { warning('The auth_host parameter is deprecated. Please use auth_uri and identity_uri instead.') neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_host': value => $auth_host; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_host': value => $auth_host; } } else{ neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_host': ensure => absent; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_host': ensure => absent; } } if $auth_port { warning('The auth_port parameter is deprecated. Please use auth_uri and identity_uri instead.') neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_port': value => $auth_port; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_port': value => $auth_port; } } else{ neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_port': ensure => absent; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_port': ensure => absent; } } if $auth_protocol { warning('The auth_protocol parameter is deprecated. Please use auth_uri and identity_uri instead.') neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_protocol': value => $auth_protocol; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_protocol': value => $auth_protocol; } } else{ neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_protocol': ensure => absent; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_protocol': ensure => absent; } $auth_uri_real = $auth_uri } elsif $auth_host and $auth_protocol and $auth_port { $auth_uri_real = "${auth_protocol}://${auth_host}:5000/" } neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_uri': value => $auth_uri_real; } neutron_api_config { 'filter:authtoken/auth_uri': value => $auth_uri_real; } if $identity_uri { neutron_config { 'keystone_authtoken/identity_uri': value => $identity_uri; 'filter:authtoken/identity_uri': value => $identity_uri; 'keystone_authtoken/identity_uri': ensure => absent; 'filter:authtoken/identity_uri': ensure => absent;

commit_message:
Automates generation of NFS config file

Currently, a user must have a file already created that contains the
NFS shares that they want to use. This change allows a user to specify
a list of NFS shares and have Puppet write them to a new file. If the
nfs_shares option is blank, then the manifest will function as it does
currently.

Change-Id: Idef1c7722bbee198e6d87e3c06217275de5469ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/27/147627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :nfs_shares_config => '/etc/cinder/shares.conf', context 'with NFS shares provided' do let (:req_params) { params.merge!({ :nfs_shares => ['10.0.0.1:/test1', '10.0.0.2:/test2'], :nfs_shares_config => '/etc/cinder/shares.conf', }) } it 'writes NFS shares to file' do should contain_file("#{req_params[:nfs_shares_config]}") \ .with_content("10.0.0.1:/test1\n10.0.0.2:/test2") end end

commit_message:
Replace deprecated max_failure_precent sla

The new sla is a failure_rate with min/max sub-keys. Update the
documentation and examples to reflect this.

Change-Id: Id947e4684aa84fe7d6c239a28b92e2a893ddaf66

commit_message:
Removed EXTRA_OPTS tuning from devstack configuration

Floating IPs are not required for nova network and devstack
doesn't set up sahara to use them anymore
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1403680).

Change-Id: I76549aa16a47fa9cfb17124f30c5e60d0c9ac287
Closes-Bug: #1403682

commit_message:
Add a debug tox environment

This uses oslo_debug_helper from oslotest to run the tests in a way
that python debuggers will work correcty. Set breakpoints in the code
with either pdb:

    import pdb; pdb.set_trace()

or ipdb:

    import ipdb; ipdb.set_trace()

Change-Id: Ic5f626abddb037beb3797c3ee5c0cf3c23be0a74

commit_message:
Use floats instead of integer in memory calculation of admin dashboard

In the case that hypervisors have large amounts of memory, you'll find that
the dashboard reports improper memory usage when in the TB and PB range.
For example, 1.95 TB as an integer equals 1 so we convert to float instead.

Closes-Bug: #1313009

Change-Id: Ie107986fa3ed9aad5c68c34353cdfc5943788069
(cherry picked from commit a309df5a16efd35d207cb78aaa59f2aebe8a3d2c)

commit_message:
Follow the argument order specified in spark-submit help

The command issued by Sahara to run jobs with spark-submit does
not put the application jar in the right place according to the
help text of spark-submit. This does not make jobs fail, but it
is good to be consistent in case something changes.

Change-Id: I50c2a969e4f747820c06d5dba39b6a8442bb5c30
Closes-Bug: #1410247

commit_message:
Fix the method about delete snapshot Interface.

Through find all snapshots in array to find the specified snapshot
ID by matching the snapshot name. Now modified to direct the assembly
snapshot ID.

Change-Id: I2537e769966ed6840db96e588a53fd4c6015ec6a
Closes-Bug: #1413511

commit_message:
Debugging aids for failed tar unpacking

We have had quite a few CI failures where we can't diagnose the cause of
the failure because g_s_f_h fails to unpack the tar file containing the
logs.

The intent of this change is to gather a little more information that
might help us figure out why we weren't able to unpack the tar.

Partial-bug: 1414098

Change-Id: Idb9115885295572d5afb825b814959b45ff429df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/88/149688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs var/log/host_info.txt --strip-components=2; then if tar tf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz var/log/upstart >/dev/null 2>&1; then tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs var/log/upstart --strip-components=3 # Extract logs for individual services from syslog to the logs directory tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs "var/log/syslog" --strip-components=2 for SERVICE in $(awk 'gsub(":|\\[.*", " ", $5) {print $5}' $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/syslog | sort -u) ; do awk "\$5 ~ \"^${SERVICE}[:\\\\[]\"" $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/syslog > $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/${SERVICE//\//_}.log done rm -f $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/syslog else if tar tf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz "var/log/audit/audit.log" >/dev/null 2>&1; then tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs "var/log/audit/audit.log" --strip-components=3 fi tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs "var/log/journal/*/system.journal" --strip-components=4 for UNIT in $(journalctl --file $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/system.journal -F _SYSTEMD_UNIT) ; do journalctl --file $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/system.journal -u $UNIT > $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/${UNIT/.service/.log} done rm -f $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/system.journal fi echo Could not unpack $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz ls -l $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz file $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz
deleted_lines: tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs var/log/host_info.txt --strip-components=2 if tar tf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz var/log/upstart >/dev/null 2>&1; then tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs var/log/upstart --strip-components=3 # Extract logs for individual services from syslog to the logs directory tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs "var/log/syslog" --strip-components=2 for SERVICE in $(awk 'gsub(":|\\[.*", " ", $5) {print $5}' $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/syslog | sort -u) ; do awk "\$5 ~ \"^${SERVICE}[:\\\\[]\"" $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/syslog > $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/${SERVICE//\//_}.log done rm -f $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/syslog if tar tf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz "var/log/audit/audit.log" >/dev/null 2>&1; then tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs "var/log/audit/audit.log" --strip-components=3 fi tar xJvf $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz -C $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs "var/log/journal/*/system.journal" --strip-components=4 for UNIT in $(journalctl --file $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/system.journal -F _SYSTEMD_UNIT) ; do journalctl --file $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/system.journal -u $UNIT > $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/${UNIT/.service/.log} done rm -f $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs/system.journal

subject: Improve performance of Unshelve api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-14 06:53:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/host_aggregate_group_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/compute/task_states.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/api/openstack/common.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_host_aggregate_group_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/compute/vm_states.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d79ebc696979e0074479002b7c778d4432ec1790', 'message': 'Improve performance of Unshelve api

Aim of this feature is to improve the performance of unshelve instance
by eliminating downloading/copying snapshot time. All instance files will be
retained in the instance store backed by shared or non-shared storage on the
compute node when an instance is shelved.

An existing configuration parameter "shelved_offload_time" will be used here
to indicate the instance files should not be deleted.

New value will be added:
shelved_offload_time = -2

Offload partially. In this case instance files will be retained. CPU and
Memory will be released back to the hypervisor which can be used for
spawning new instances.

Added new VM state 'SHELVED_PARTIAL_OFFLOADED' and new Task state
'SHELVING_PARTIAL_OFFLOADING', so user can identify by VM status
that, instance is partially offloaded and instance files are persisted
on the host.

Added new scheduling filter 'HostAggregateGroupFilter' which can filter
the host on the basis of 'host aggregate group id' stored in the
filter_properties.

DocImpact:
An existing configuration parameter “shelved_offload_time" will be modified
here to indicate the instance files shouldn’t be deleted.

-1, never offload
0, offload when shelved
> 0, offload using “_poll_shelved_instances” periodic task

New value will be added
-2, offload partially, release CPU/Memory but retain instance files

If HostAggregate groups configured with same properties on multiple NFS,
then add 'HostAggregateGroupFilter' in the 'scheduler_default_filters'
configuration parameter as mentioned below:
scheduler_default_filters=HostAggregateGroupFilter,AvailabilityZoneFilter,...

Change-Id: I2c69b76cc5a0a642e5725c108f3ed26d4b0cc98c
blueprint: improve-unshelve-performance
'}]
commit_message:
Improve performance of Unshelve api

Aim of this feature is to improve the performance of unshelve instance
by eliminating downloading/copying snapshot time. All instance files will be
retained in the instance store backed by shared or non-shared storage on the
compute node when an instance is shelved.

An existing configuration parameter "shelved_offload_time" will be used here
to indicate the instance files should not be deleted.

New value will be added:
shelved_offload_time = -2

Offload partially. In this case instance files will be retained. CPU and
Memory will be released back to the hypervisor which can be used for
spawning new instances.

Added new VM state 'SHELVED_PARTIAL_OFFLOADED' and new Task state
'SHELVING_PARTIAL_OFFLOADING', so user can identify by VM status
that, instance is partially offloaded and instance files are persisted
on the host.

Added new scheduling filter 'HostAggregateGroupFilter' which can filter
the host on the basis of 'host aggregate group id' stored in the
filter_properties.

DocImpact:
An existing configuration parameter “shelved_offload_time" will be modified
here to indicate the instance files shouldn’t be deleted.

-1, never offload
0, offload when shelved
> 0, offload using “_poll_shelved_instances” periodic task

New value will be added
-2, offload partially, release CPU/Memory but retain instance files

If HostAggregate groups configured with same properties on multiple NFS,
then add 'HostAggregateGroupFilter' in the 'scheduler_default_filters'
configuration parameter as mentioned below:
scheduler_default_filters=HostAggregateGroupFilter,AvailabilityZoneFilter,...

Change-Id: I2c69b76cc5a0a642e5725c108f3ed26d4b0cc98c
blueprint: improve-unshelve-performance

added_lines: def create_image(context, instance, name, image_type, image_api, extra_properties=None): """Create new image entry in the image service. This new image will be reserved for the compute manager to upload a snapshot or backup. :param context: security context :param instance: nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Instance :param name: string for name of the snapshot :param image_type: snapshot | backup :param extra_properties: dict of extra image properties to include """ if extra_properties is None: extra_properties = {} instance_uuid = instance['uuid'] properties = { 'instance_uuid': instance_uuid, 'user_id': str(context.user_id), 'image_type': image_type, } image_ref = instance.image_ref sent_meta = get_image_metadata(context, image_api, image_ref, instance) sent_meta['name'] = name sent_meta['is_public'] = False # The properties set up above and in extra_properties have precedence properties.update(extra_properties or {}) sent_meta['properties'].update(properties) return image_api.create(context, sent_meta)

commit_message:
Fix unit test failure due to tests sharing mocks

A recent refactor made test_get_port_vnic_info 2 and 3 share code
in a private method _test_get_port_vnic_info(). A mock on this method
is shared between the tests and can cause the following failure:

AssertionError: Expected to be called once. Called 2 times.

This is changed so that the two test methods create separate mocks and
pass to the shared method.

Change-Id: I3902b7b7cf4b4b3fdc2885bf2611a712d008c617
Closes-Bug: #1381414
(cherry picked from commit f91d4ebeac9181ff279158fe89a8d50b34184a89)

commit_message:
Refactoring datasource, job and job_binary name validations

This change adds the ability to have leading numerals in the names of
data sources, jobs, and job binaries. It also separates the name
validation of user keypairs to be inline with nova's validation rules.

Changes
* refactoring validate_name_format to allow leading numeral
* adding validate_keypair_name_format
* adding tests for keypair name validation
* fixing tests for new name rules
* removing outdated test from test_cluster_create_v_keypair_type

Change-Id: Ia500beb21412c535b153bfadc54cd0a4d1269262
Closes-Bug: 1376784

commit_message:
Add parameter to manage usage of Neutron l3_ha option

This change will allow for the enablement of Neutron routers HA
via the new NeutronL3HA parameter.

Change-Id: Ia5f7c0b4e89159456482e840c50d166ec5f25d4c
Implements: blueprint tripleo-icehouse-ha-production-configuration

The rsyslog container is unable to read the log files produced by the
other containers due to permissions issues and inconsistant user:group
ownership and user:group presence between containers.

The simplest way of dealing with this is to ensure that the log
directory allows read and traversal rights for all users.

This patch ensures that the log directory is always created by the
container_common role for containers.

This patch also add the processing of swift logs to logstash. The
template was always there, but had no task which deployed it.

commit_message:
Ensure that permissions are permissible enough for the rsyslog container

The rsyslog container is unable to read the log files produced by the
other containers due to permissions issues and inconsistant user:group
ownership and user:group presence between containers.

The simplest way of dealing with this is to ensure that the log
directory allows read and traversal rights for all users.

This patch ensures that the log directory is always created by the
container_common role for containers.

This patch also add the processing of swift logs to logstash. The
template was always there, but had no task which deployed it.

Change-Id: I6ec12b2f2302e0cffc2a36096d38cb85e4b3ab04
Closes-Bug: #1407633
Related-Bug: #1403890

commit_message:
Adds negative unittests to test_backup_controller.py

This submission adds two negative tests under
"trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backup_controller.py" script.

Following are the negative tests -
1. test_validate_create_with_blankname
2. test_validate_create_with_invalidname

Change-Id: Ia3841c1258323706a4b234d25bc012f0f64462a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/56/142056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_validate_create_with_blankname(self): body = {"backup": {"instance": self.uuid, "name": ' '}} schema = self.controller.get_schema('create', body) validator = jsonschema.Draft4Validator(schema) self.assertFalse(validator.is_valid(body)) errors = sorted(validator.iter_errors(body), key=lambda e: e.path) self.assertEqual(len(errors), 1) self.assertIn("' ' does not match '^.*[0-9a-zA-Z]+.*$'", errors[0].message) def test_validate_create_with_invalidname(self): body = {"backup": {"instance": self.uuid, "name": '$#@&?'}} schema = self.controller.get_schema('create', body) validator = jsonschema.Draft4Validator(schema) self.assertFalse(validator.is_valid(body)) errors = sorted(validator.iter_errors(body), key=lambda e: e.path) self.assertEqual(len(errors), 1) self.assertIn("'$#@&?' does not match '^.*[0-9a-zA-Z]+.*$'", errors[0].message)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-25 04:08:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration/commit/a3ceab56d54855e16de7b35f087a7c53648c6ded', 'message': "Read conf files from /etc/trove

During instance create the taskmanager will write /etc/trove/guest_info
and /etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf. See bug 1309030 -- previously the
taskmanager would write /etc/guest_info.

Update the guest agent init scripts as follows:

 - Read /etc/trove/guest_info rather than /etc/guest_info.
 - If guestagent.conf was injected by taskmanager during boot, don't rsync
   and overwrite it.
 - Maintain compatibility with taskmanagers that still write
   /etc/guest_info.

commit_message:
Read conf files from /etc/trove/conf.d

Modify guestagent init scripts to read conf files from /etc/trove/conf.d
rather than /etc.

Added backwards compatibility code until patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100381 merges.

Co-authored-by: Duk Loi <duk@tesora.com>
Change-Id: I1dffd373da722af55bdea41fead8456bb60c82b2
Related-Bug: 1309030
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/23/102423/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Move guest_info to /etc/trove if it was written to the old location ExecStartPre=/bin/bash "test -f /etc/guest_info && sudo mkdir -p /etc/trove && mv /etc/guest_info /etc/trove/guest_info" # Copy guestagent.conf if it was not injected by taskmanager ExecStartPre=/bin/bash "test -f /etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf || sudo mkdir -p /etc/trove && sudo -u GUEST_USERNAME rsync -e 'ssh -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no' -avz --exclude='.*' HOST_SCP_USERNAME@NETWORK_GATEWAY:/etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf ~GUEST_USERNAME/ && mv ~GUEST_USERNAME/trove-guestagent.conf /etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf" ExecStartPre=/bin/bash "chmod +r /etc/trove/*" ExecStart=/home/GUEST_USERNAME/trove/bin/trove-guestagent --config-file=/etc/trove/guest_info --config-file=/etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf
deleted_lines: # If /etc/trove does not exist, create it and then copy the trove-guestagent.conf # from /etc/trove on the user's development environment, ExecStartPre=/bin/bash "test -d /etc/trove || sudo mkdir -p /etc/trove && sudo -u GUEST_USERNAME rsync -e 'ssh -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no' -avz --exclude='.*' HOST_SCP_USERNAME@NETWORK_GATEWAY:/etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf ~GUEST_USERNAME/ && mv ~GUEST_USERNAME/trove-guestagent.conf /etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf" ExecStart=/home/GUEST_USERNAME/trove/bin/trove-guestagent --config-file=/etc/guest_info --config-file=/etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf

commit_message:
Implement Fixed IP PTR Record API

This change adds support for fixed IPs to the API.  This work extends
the work done for handling floating IPs.

blueprint fixed-ip-ptrs

Change-Id: I00ae48f386545c3873cb7c245f8780453146c0de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/80/81580/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list_ports(self, context, region=None): """ Get ports based on the current context from Neutron """ endpoints = self._endpoints( service_catalog=context.service_catalog, service_type='network', endpoint_type=CONF['network_api:neutron'].endpoint_type, config_section='network_api:neutron', region=region) tg = threadgroup.ThreadGroup() failed = [] data = [] def _call(endpoint, region, *args, **kw): client = get_client(context, endpoint=endpoint) LOG.debug("Attempting to fetch Ports from %s @ %s", endpoint, region) try: ports = client.list_ports(*args, **kw) except neutron_exceptions.Unauthorized as e: # NOTE: 401 might be that the user doesn't have neutron # activated in a particular region, we'll just log the failure # and go on with our lives. msg = "Calling Neutron resulted in a 401, please investigate." LOG.warning(msg) LOG.exception(e) return except Exception as e: LOG.error('Failed calling Neutron %s - %s', region, endpoint) LOG.exception(e) failed.append((e, endpoint, region)) return LOG.debug(ports) for port in ports['ports']: for fixed_ip in port['fixed_ips']: data.append({ 'device_id': port['device_id'], 'address': fixed_ip['ip_address'], 'region': region }) LOG.debug("Added %i Ports from %s @ %s", len(data), endpoint, region) for endpoint, region in endpoints: tg.add_thread(_call, endpoint, region, tenant_id=context.tenant_id) tg.wait() # NOTE: Sadly tg code doesn't give us a good way to handle failures. if failed: msg = 'Failed retrieving Ports from Neutron in %s' % \ ", ".join(['%s - %s' % (i[1], i[2]) for i in failed]) raise exceptions.NeutronCommunicationFailure(msg) return data

Add expose-soa-ns spec

Change-Id: I2fab168c8bf99b6c59073f76fa6a12ebe3281bed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/01/100901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================== Expose SOA and NS Records =========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/expose-soa-ns Designate currently generates and hides each zones NS and SOA records, this can be confusing for users who expect all records to be visible in the API. Problem description =================== Generated records, such as the NS and SOA records are currently hidden from end users - this is confusing and counterintuitive. Additionally, as we move towards mDNS, the missing NS and SOA records in the designate database will result in needing to port the SOA/NS record generation from the backends into the mDNS service. Treating these records the same as any other allows us to keep mDNS simple. Proposed change =============== API Changes ----------- The V2 API will be updated to include the zones SOA and NS recordsets, similar to any other recordset. These RecordSets will initially be read-only. Customers will not be able to add/remove/update records in these RecordSets. In the future, we may allow for rebranding of the NS record values. This will be covered by a future blueprint. Central Changes --------------- SOA and NS RecordSet/Record generation will be moved from the Backends, into Central. These generated RecordSet/Record's will be persisted to Storage in the same way as customer defined RecordSet/Record's. The CUD (Create, Update, Delete) methods for RecordSets and Records will be updated to trigger a re-generation of the SOA record, similar to how they currently trigger a increment of the Zone's serial number. These changes will require that all Storage iteractions within a single Central RPC call are grouped into a single transaction. This will be achieved using a method decorator applied to all central RPC methods which perform write operations against Storage. Storage Changes --------------- The StorageAPI class will be made redundant, as transactions and rollback will be handled by the central method decorator. Backend Changes --------------- Management / Generation of SOA and NS records will be removed from the backend implementations. Other Changes ------------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: https://launchpad.net/~kiall Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-2 Work Items ---------- - Implement the Central method decorator, removing StorageAPI - Implement the Central changes to generate SOA records upon CUD of RRSets/RR's, also removing SOA/NS management from Backends. Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Add functional tests for IptablesManager using tcp/udp

This commit adds tests for filter table using tcp and udp protocols.
Part of it is a NetcatTester class providing ability to test connection
between two veth pairs in namespaces.

Change-Id: I6db1e7ffef5e1243478e15a994787396b0908656
Related-Bug: 1243216
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/49/120349/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventlet from neutron.agent.linux import async_processPROTOCOL_BLOCK_RULE = '-p %s -j DROP' PROTOCOL_PORT_BLOCK_RULE = '-p %s --dport %d -j DROP'TCP_TIMEOUT = 1 @staticmethod def _iptables_ipv4_filter_add_rule(manager, *args, **kwargs): manager.ipv4['filter'].add_rule(*args, **kwargs) manager.apply() @staticmethod def _iptables_ipv4_filter_remove_rule(manager, *args, **kwargs): manager.ipv4['filter'].remove_rule(*args, **kwargs) manager.apply() def _spawn_nc_in_namespace(self, namespace, address, port, udp=False, listen=False): cmd = ['nc', address, str(port)] if udp: cmd.append('-u') else: cmd.extend(['-w', TCP_TIMEOUT]) if listen: cmd.append('-l') proc = async_process.AsyncNsProcess(cmd, namespace, root_helper=self.root_helper) proc.start() proc.ensure_process_is_running() return proc @staticmethod def _wait_for_output(proc, timeout): with eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout, async_process.AsyncProcessException): output = list(proc.iter_stdout()) while not output: output = list(proc.iter_stdout()) eventlet.sleep() return output class TestIptablesManager(IpBase): NC_PORT = 12345 def setUp(self): super(TestIptablesManager, self).setUp() self.src_iptables = iptables_manager.IptablesManager( root_helper=self.root_helper, namespace=self.src_ns.namespace) self.dst_iptables = iptables_manager.IptablesManager( self._iptables_ipv4_filter_add_rule(self.dst_iptables, 'INPUT', PROTOCOL_BLOCK_RULE % 'icmp') self._iptables_ipv4_filter_remove_rule(self.dst_iptables, 'INPUT', PROTOCOL_BLOCK_RULE % 'icmp') def _send_data(self, data, udp): dst_nc = self._spawn_nc_in_namespace(self.dst_ns.namespace, self.DST_ADDRESS, self.NC_PORT, listen=True, udp=udp) src_nc = self._spawn_nc_in_namespace(self.src_ns.namespace, self.DST_ADDRESS, self.NC_PORT, udp=udp) eventlet.sleep(TCP_TIMEOUT * 2) try: src_nc.ensure_process_is_running() except async_process.AsyncProcessException: dst_nc.stop(raise_on_error=False) raise src_nc.write('foo') output = self._wait_for_output(dst_nc, 2) dst_nc.stop(raise_on_error=False) src_nc.stop(raise_on_error=False) return output def _test_with_nc(self, iptables_manager, chain, block_rule, udp): with self.assert_max_execution_time(10): dst_output = self._send_data('foo', udp=udp) self.assertEqual(['foo'], dst_output) self._iptables_ipv4_filter_add_rule( iptables_manager, chain, block_rule) self.assertRaises(async_process.AsyncProcessException, self._send_data, 'foo', udp=udp) self._iptables_ipv4_filter_remove_rule( iptables_manager, chain, block_rule) dst_output = self._send_data('foo', udp=udp) self.assertEqual(['foo'], dst_output) def test_tcp_input_port(self): self._test_with_nc(self.dst_iptables, 'INPUT', PROTOCOL_PORT_BLOCK_RULE % ('tcp', self.NC_PORT), False) def test_tcp_output_port(self): self._test_with_nc(self.src_iptables, 'OUTPUT', PROTOCOL_PORT_BLOCK_RULE % ('tcp', self.NC_PORT), False) def test_tcp_input(self): self._test_with_nc(self.dst_iptables, 'INPUT', PROTOCOL_BLOCK_RULE % 'tcp', False) def test_udp_input_port(self): self._test_with_nc(self.dst_iptables, 'INPUT', PROTOCOL_PORT_BLOCK_RULE % ('udp', self.NC_PORT), True) def test_udp_output_port(self): self._test_with_nc(self.src_iptables, 'OUTPUT', PROTOCOL_PORT_BLOCK_RULE % ('udp', self.NC_PORT), True)
deleted_lines: ICMP_BLOCK_RULE = '-p icmp -j DROP' class IptablesManagerTestCase(IpBase): def setUp(self): super(IptablesManagerTestCase, self).setUp() self.iptables = iptables_manager.IptablesManager( self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', ICMP_BLOCK_RULE) self.iptables.apply() self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].remove_rule('INPUT', ICMP_BLOCK_RULE) self.iptables.apply()

""" SoftwareDeployment object """ from heat.db import api as db_api from heat.objects import base class SoftwareDeployment(base.HeatObject): @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): return db_api.software_deployment_create(context, values) @classmethod def get(cls, context, deployment_id): return db_api.software_deployment_get(context, deployment_id) @classmethod def get_all(cls, context, server_id=None): return db_api.software_deployment_get_all(context, server_id) @classmethod def update(cls, context, deployment_id, values): return db_api.software_deployment_update( context, deployment_id, values) @classmethod def delete(cls, context, deployment_id): return db_api.software_deployment_delete(context, deployment_id)

""" UserCreds object """ from heat.db import api as db_api from heat.objects import base class UserCreds(base.HeatObject): @classmethod def create(cls, context): return db_api.user_creds_create(context) @classmethod def delete(cls, context, user_creds_id): return db_api.user_creds_delete(context, user_creds_id) @classmethod def get(cls, context_id): return db_api.user_creds_get(context_id)

commit_message:
Fixed master_node_settings tests

- created DBSingletonHandler class for singleton DB objects
- removed strange master_node_settings.yaml fixture
- removed skipped tests
- added master_node_uid validation test
- other tests fixes

Change-Id: I297cd13b79464b47cc89fac45af3814d8c60c422
Implements: blueprint nailgun-code-testing-improvements
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/13/147513/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nailgun import utilsclass SingletonHandler(SingleHandler): """Manages an object that is supposed to have only one entry in the DB (a DB singleton). """ not_found_error = "Object not found in the DB" def get_one_or_404(self): try: instance = self.single.get_one(fail_if_not_found=True) except errors.ObjectNotFound: raise self.http(404, self.not_found_error) return instance @content def GET(self): """Get singleton object from DB :http: * 200 (OK) * 404 (Object not found in DB) """ instance = self.get_one_or_404() return self.single.to_json(instance) @content def PUT(self): """Change object in DB :http: * 200 (OK) * 400 (Invalid data) * 404 (Object not present in DB) """ data = self.checked_data(self.validator.validate_update) instance = self.get_one_or_404() self.single.update(instance, data) return self.single.to_json(instance) @content def PATCH(self): """Update object :http: * 200 (OK) * 400 (Invalid data) * 404 (Object not present in DB) """ data = self.checked_data(self.validator.validate_update) instance = self.get_one_or_404() instance.update(utils.dict_merge( self.single.serializer.serialize(instance), data )) return self.single.to_json(instance)

revisions:

In the settings, you can deactivate IPv6 by adding "'enable_ipv6':
False" to OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK dictionary. This disables the
IP version input when you create a network, but you still have "IPv6
Address Configuration Mode" option in subnet creation form.
This patch disables the subnet IPv6 option as it does for network IP

Change-Id: Ic01ded32c9d21a89da96106badd5545c1099b9ff
Closes-bug: #1413168
'}]
commit_message:
Disable the IPv6 components in Subnet form

In the settings, you can deactivate IPv6 by adding "'enable_ipv6':
False" to OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK dictionary. This disables the
IP version input when you create a network, but you still have "IPv6
Address Configuration Mode" option in subnet creation form.
This patch disables the subnet IPv6 option as it does for network IP
version choice.

Change-Id: Ic01ded32c9d21a89da96106badd5545c1099b9ff
Closes-bug: #1413168

commit_message:
Fix manifest url doesn't work

Metadata of Pod/Service/RepplicationController must be persisted to database,
but it doesn't work with manifest_url. This fixes it.

Change-Id: I4da065e7dfc5345120ee5bc12d931a7707432010
Closes-Bug: #1412646
